Reviews.Title: “Fancy hip hotel in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: Guywhotakestrips
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in the center of downtown Napa. Of course, if you are looking for a quiet stay by a vineyard you would not stay here--there are a hundred options in Napa Valley for that. But if you're looking for a place in downtown Napa which is close to the nightlife and what have you, then this is by far your best option. The rooms are luxorious, and have the feel of an upscale soho condo. Great choice. The tub in the tub-suite is huge.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back...with my darling husband”
Reviews.Author: 2BusyMom
Reviews.Content: Loved the sheets, the staff were very friendly and nice. Breakfast was wonderful, it was included with a AAA Special. The beds and pillows were incredibly comfortable. We only spent one night but I would love to be there for a longer visit sometime soon. The hotel location was very convenient but not very scenic. Free parking! Always a good thing. We stayed in a double king room which was perfect since we were traveling with our 12 year old (and he's getting too big to sleep comfortably on pull out sofa beds). I loved the shower, but didn't like the sliding door design with the large gap (not as much privacy as I like to see in a bath). The "free" wi-fi, was a total "bust". It doesn't work, the staff knows it doesn't work and this was unfortunate. I hope that they get a stronger signal to the rooms when I visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackysparkle
Reviews.Content: Just a lovely experience . Great room with sitting area and huge flat screen tv. Location was great for all shopping in Napa. Walking distance to just about all type of eating experience. Walk by the river was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: This beautifully designed hotel fits right into the Napa landscape. Located in the heart of town, dozens of great restaurants and shops are just steps away for our room. The staff is super friendly and the entire facility is immaculate. I would come to Napa again just to stay here. My onlys gripe is tht the fitness center, which is open to the public, is a little dated and the local members seem to have a bug up their butts about tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Napa Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Andrew K
Reviews.Content: The Avia is a wonderful hotel and not over the top. It is well located in downtown napa near plenty of action, restaurants, coffee houses etc. It is comparable to a "W" or like. For the price it blows away the Napa Embassy Suites. The rooms are well done and modern. Really a solid choice

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot in Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: smignogna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just concluded an unbelievable trip to Wine Country! It was our first time, and we LOVED IT. We are avid travelers and always take our time when selecting our accomodations. The Avia is absolutely the best place to stay in downtown Napa. The staff is amazingly friendly, the concierge's are sooo helpful with daily itineraries for winery visits, and the location is picture perfect. Downtown Napa is a posh small city with amazing restaurants, tasting rooms, and shopping. You are located right next to both highway 29 and the silverado trail, and very close to Sonoma and The Carneros region. We wanted to split our trip up by spending a few nights in downtown Napa, and a few nights out in "the middle of nowhere" with views of the mountains and wineries. I will definately be coming back here. The rooms are gorgeous and big, the breakfast is fantastic, the complimentary tastings from local wine reps on Friday and Saturday Nights are a great touch, and best of all the rates are sooo affordable. If you have AAA, acquire about a AAA rate which lowers your rate and gives you $40 per day towards breakfast! Wineries Visited (Look these up, they are unreal): Domaine Carneros (Amazing courtyard views and champagne) Artesa (Best views in all of Napa) Michael Mondavi (Great Spellbound Chardonnay) Robert Mondavi (Great tour for first timers) Cline (Wonderful Desert wine with Chocolate Pairing) Jacuzzi (Free Tasting, unreal variety) V. Sattui (Great wines and great lunch spot) Alpha Omega (Favorite Red Wines in all of Napa!) Castello Di Amoroso (You need to see this to believe it, its a castle and 2/3 underground!! Great wine also) Sterling Vineyard (You take a sky cable car to the vineyard! Talk about nice touch!) Clos Du Val (Great wines) Louis Martini (Unreal wines) Regusci (Unreal wines) Have fun and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Most romantic hotel in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: Jill L
Reviews.Content: Could not have pictured a better place for an annivesary weekend. Worth the upgrade to the tub suite, not only do you get a gorgeous king size tub, there is also a fireplace and a huge shower with an overhead Rain shower head along with a long counter and double sinks - very swanky. Decor is cool contemporary. Loved the outfoor firepit and the bar was lively and happening after a day of touring the wineries. I followed two recommendations from the Concierge and they were spot on. Wish I had used her recomemmendations on everything as some of my choices were not as good.

Reviews.Title: “Aviaaaaaaaaah!”
Reviews.Author: jaxmarquez
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, the color scheme and decor was very neat,clean, modern and soothing. The staff is very friendly and attentive the minute you pull up to the front of the hotel. My girlfriends and I commented how well mannered and especially well groomed all the staff seem to be. The room was nice, large, very clean. The beds were comfy and large. Loved the bathroom with double sinks, wish every hotel had them. Especially loved the large mirror in the middle of the room. Again, every hotel should have one. The Avia seemed to be the most exciting thing going on in Downtown NAPA. The streets were pretty quiet and only a few places to go close by so we opted to stay and dine at the hotel. Room Service was great, housekeeping great and an overall excellent experience. Will definitely stay at Avia for any future visits to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore from”
Reviews.Author: ScottPortland_Oregon
Reviews.Content: Ok, we are from Oregon so thought we should go to California to get away from the rain. Nope, didn't happen. However, there was a bright spot to our trip -- Avia Napa. This boutique hotel is in the heart of the city. Even before you get into the hotel, you are warmly greeted by the the door staff and every other staff member you encounter. All of the employees working at the hotel are friendly and helpful. The hotel has a comfortable modern appearance. We decided to get a room with a fireplace, jetted tub and terrace. We were not disappointed. After a long day wine tasting, we brought back food and wine to our hotel room and had dinner on the terrace. Since you are in downtown, there isn't much of a view, but the huge terrace made you feel like you were at your own little winery. They also offered a turn down service with free water and chocolate -- who could turn that down. We had breakfast at the hotel which was part of our package. Food was fine, and service was fast. There is parking behind the hotel. If you want a place to unwind after a busy day, this hotel is a great base for expiration of the wine country.

Reviews.Title: “best value”
Reviews.Author: k2maui
Reviews.Content: This is a nice upscale hotel that is much more affordable than many properties in Napa. The location is right downtown also, great for walking to restaurants, market, etc. Rooms are very spacious with nice fireplaces. No view though.

Reviews.Title: “1st Stop on the Honeymoon :)”
Reviews.Author: RachnBran
Reviews.Content: Napa was our first stop on our honeymoon and Avia was a perfect choice! We loved how modern the room was and the bathroom was awesome. One of the best perks was the free parking behind the hotel, which was surprising to us. The hotel staff was great and was very friendly. We enjoyed being downtown Napa and being within walking distance to many resturants. When we arrived we asked the councierge for recommendations and she gave us an envelope full of tickets for free tastings around downtown and deals on dinners or apps at various resturants. I recommend asking for suggestions and the coupons, it was a great help. The room was a little small but it was perfect for the 2 of us and our bags for just 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “The best Napa has to offer”
Reviews.Author: RAlayne
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with the Avia Napa! Not knowing anything about Napa Valley, I booked this hotel for my husband's 30th birthday trip and hoped for the best. We were happily surprised and our expectations were exceeded in almost every way. The boutique hotel is well appointed and has beautiful rustic meets contemporary decor. The fire pits on the veranda offer a perfect escape to enjoy a glass of wine and the hotel restaurant's delicious cheese plate. The front desk and valet staff are incredibly helpful, while the attention to detail and added touches are what set this hotel apart. For example, the complimentary wine tastings on Thursday and Friday evenings were superb! My only complaints would be the average room is snug for someone that overpacks (like me!), and the waitstaff during breakfast seemed a bit preoccupied but were friendly nonetheless. However, those two minor issues aside, I would stay at the Avia again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: andyrout1
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights recently & really enjoyed it. An extremely comfortable and luxurious hotel from which to explore the beautiful Napa region. Very professional and courteous staff, lovely comfortable rooms which are very well appointed. Very smooth check in and out. It's also well located right in the town centre, with plenty of dining and drinking options nearby. Worth researching the dining options as there are many, many excellent places to eat out in the town. Didn't make use of the hotel dining, or any of their additional services, so can't comment on this. Only complaint would be that the hotel bar doesn't have a liquor license!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel- lives up to the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: SYDSarah_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel pays close attention to all the details, and we couldn't help but have a fabulous stay here. It's feels very boutique. The staff are super friendly and helpful, and the hotel rooms are huge (we booked a lounge suite). The location is also a bonus and you can walk around downtown Napa easily from the hotel. Juliette the Concierge was also a great help with travel and booking tours. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we took a chance on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: duty2009
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel, better than I had anticipated. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The feel is so inviting and warm. Loved all the different fireplaces you could sit around, yes in Napa we found ourselves by the fire in the evening. The outdoor terrace is amazing, wish we had spent more time there and by the fire pits. Guess we have to go back!!! Our room was quiet, comfortable and roomy, loved how the TV turned from the little seating area to the bed. Overall, great place and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: world_citizen61
Reviews.Content: This is a contemporary but warm and comfortable hotel in downtown Napa. Although there is not much to see or do right in town, we did find some good restaurants and it was a great hotel to come back to at the end of a long day. The bathrooms are very modern and beautiful, with glass showers and two types of shower heads, including the rain shower head. Our room faced the courtyard in the back and was extremely quiet. There was a fire pit in the courtyard for use during better weather. The service we received was also very good, especially the doormen who were ready with a large umbrella to lend on the way out because of the torrential rains we experienced on and off during our stay. There is free parking but it is in a garage behind the hotel without direct access. Overall, great value and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: Halle B
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and loved it! It met all of our expectations and more! The staff was extremely friendly and helped whenever asked. The hotel was in downtown Napa which afforded us the luxury of walking to all the amazing restaurants around town. We had a corner suite which was large and comfortable. One tip is to not park at valet, since there is a free parking garage around the corner that guests of the hotel can park overnight for free. Save the $15 charge for valet and head over to the pub across the street instead!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Salhowl
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel without any expectations. You never know with a Hyatt. But this hotel is really very nice. The staff was helpful, the rooms are nice -you can even open a small window to get some fresh air! Every evening the housekeepers would come by with water and chocolate. We took a Platypus tour of some wineries -which the concierge had recommended and that was great also. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: applied1
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for one night. Our room is on the small side, but is nicely appointed and the bathroom has nice amenities - oversized shower with waterfall showerhead, contemporary look. Bed is most comfortable, but I wish the pillows were bouncier. Service was great, no complaint. We needed help with the TV hookup, and the guy showed up almost right away after our call to the front desk. He even stayed to make sure our internet setup was fine before leaving. Breakfast was very good - nice offerings of fresh local ingredients in many of the items on the menu. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much. We may come back when we get the chance. The only thing to report: walls are a bit thin, and we could easily hear conversations of our neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “made us feel like we were special”
Reviews.Author: Christine K
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, but modern and very comfortable. Very clean, modern bathrooms with rainforest shower.. could have stayed in there all day. Staff couldn't have been nicer and more considerate. Bellman/Doormen were awesome and very quick about getting our car out for us from valet. Will stay here again when in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: LeahL1010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights while doing a quick tour of Napa. The hotel itself is very modern and has an almost zen-like quality to it. We stayed in a luxury suite and it was fabulous. Lots of room, very bright, clean and simple. The beds were ultra soft and little extras like the complimentary robes, the oversized shower, quality toiletries and free wifi were appreciated. We only ate in the restaurant one time for breakfast but it was delicious with a lot of fresh, healthy options. The location is convenient as it is an easy walk to some great restaurants - which is a good thing after drinking a bottle of wine from the day's wine tours with dinner! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick J
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and clean. A little small but was satisfactory for our needs. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The downside is no pool or spa. Parking is around the back and requires a bit of a walk. The biggest issue I had with this place is the billing. The bill they slid under our door had a charge of $4.50 for peanuts which we didn't consume. When my girlfriend called the front desk about it they confused her with a previous guest who had called about the same issue. I looked at my credit card statement on-line before checking out and discovered the bill was more than double what is was supposed to be. We called the front desk on this matter and were told that we were charged someone elses bill and to not worry it would be fixed soon. Three days later they still have not corrected it properly. I highly suggest you keep a close eye on what they charge to you. If I am to assume this was an isolated incident, I can give them the benefit of doubt, would be willing to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel convenient location for Napa & wineries”
Reviews.Author: Barbsrubyslippers
Reviews.Content: This beautifully decorated hotel is situated in the center of downtown Napa. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and modern. The mattresses and pillows are soft, very comfortable for those who prefer that. The oversized soaking tubs are great when paired with a room upgraded with fireplace. The door to the bathroom slides closed and therefore is not much privacy. A couple of complaints about the large open shower, the overhead rain shower is a nice plus but it cannot be operated at the same time as the regular directional shower head. Additionally, on a Saturday morning around 9 to 10 am, there was no hot water. There is a restaurant in the lobby, but we experienced poor service, and extremely overpriced food. Our party of 4 waited 45minutes for food, while the waitress kept apologizing but doing nothing to help. Overpriced because for 2, 2 egg breakfasts with 2 lattes was $50. While opting for convience we were actually delayed, gobbled our food in a rush, and made late to our appointment with Far Niente. Overall, great hotel, but avoid the restaurant. Many great restaurants around the area. Also, an issue with noise late night noise from terrace with firepit on the 2nd floor, which is great for casual gatherings. The 2nd floor rooms facing the terrace can hear and see everything, there needs to be a reasonable closing time for its use. At midnight, we heard a very inebriated group of people shouting on the terrace for about 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: dubupak
Reviews.Content: It was great to find a modern hotel in Napa, with a great location. Unfortunately the service at the front desk, and valet left a lot to be desired. We asked if there were any bigger rooms that we could upgrade to (and pay for) but she quickly dismissed it by saying 'no.' We were on our babymoon, and hubby was trying to get a nicer, bigger room for us. Later we checked online and found that you could book the larger suites for the same nights. So we called back down to let them know and they were not able to articulate a response that made sense. I did love the Lather bath products they provide, and there is free parking behind the hotel. I would have given it 5 stars probably, if the customer service was even slightly better. I would probably stay here again, hoping that customer service will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-70005
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of new restaurants and wine tasting rooms. The rooms are pretty, comfortable and clean but not too big. It has two awesome fire pits on their second floor terrace where you can go and enjoy the wines you have bought throughout the day. You can sit down on a nice sofa or on rocking chairs while sipping wine and talking to other guests. This proved to be awesome because you get to share your favorites wineries and restaurants with other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Modern Hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: I stay at the AVIA Napa on a recent business trip and was really pleased with the hotel. The city of Napa isn't where I stay normally on vacation trips to the Napa Valley, I usually go deeper into the valley, but on business, I always stay in Napa, which is a lovely town in its own right and has some very good restaurants and bars. The hotel decor is a great mix of the modern and traditional. You don't feel like you are in the starkness that some hotels have these days, but you don't feel like you are in your grandmother's parlor either. The lobby is just very tasteful and comfortable. The rooms are great. To me they are designed for the traveling professional. The rooms are large by hotel standards, you have a great coffee maker, a good work space, hi speed Internet and a in room safe big enough for your lap top. They also also have a plug in for your MPS player and a big flat panel TV. I can't really say if it was HD, probably not given its size, but it was great anyway. The best features of my room were the bathroom, which is big and had a great shower, the fireplace and the lanai. I doubt every room has a fireplace, but it was a nice touch in my room. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Overall it was a great experience and I'll probably return for a couple of nights with the DW on a wine country trip before heading up to St. Helena for the rest of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back. Now.”
Reviews.Author: Puddles126
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. From the second we pulled up to the front door to unload our bags, we knew it would be, and I don't think there was a moment when any of us thought otherwise. Every single one of the staff we spoke with was super friendly and helpful. The bell boy made some dinner recommendations while bringing our bags up to our room, and they did not disappoint. The hotel is beautifully designed...low lighting, sophisticated, great art and furnishings. This continued on into the room. Big room with two king beds...the most comfortable hotel bed, or maybe even bed period, that I've ever had the privileged of sleeping in. We even asked what kind of sheets they used and checked the mattress label. The bathroom was gorgeous as well....two sinks, huge standing shower with a rainfall shower head. Just awesome. Only complaint is that the rolling barn door to the bathroom wasn't quite seamless so it was a little uncomfortable using the bathroom since we were staying with friends. The door itself was cool though. It wouldn't have been a concern if we weren't sharing a room. And the iPod dock in our room had a bad speaker. That is all. Location was perfect for enjoying downtown Napa. It was a little chilly but we definitely would have walked around more than we did if the weather was a little nicer. There are quite a few good restaurants, wine bars, and shops all within walking distance. Even Oxbow Market is just a 10-15 minute walk. Free parking in the deck adjacent to the building, valet for an extra fee. A quick drive to many many vineyards. Enjoyed ending the night sitting around the fire on the terrace with a bottle of wine. I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousA1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Napa. The Avia is a great hotel in a great location. You can walk to dinner or hop on HWY 29 quickly to get to wineries. The service was very good and the hotel is beautiful. Well thought out design, great bathrooms, amazingly comfortable beds, free parking behind the hotel, and computer center for checking messages. Only issue is sound proofing; you can hear the louder guests in the hallways. Would still highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: IKE48
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located hotel in Napa to hub all your wine country experiences. Several great restaurants located near by.

Reviews.Title: “Nive. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MSPilot
Reviews.Content: I love this cute little hotel right down town! My wife and I love to walk around and do some wine tasting and walk back. This hotel is superb! It's modern style sets it apart from most other hotels in the area. It is unique in its own right. Very clean and customer service is top notch! The price is right and the value for the dollar is definitely there. The only draw back is parking. It's around the block but only a two minute walk. We didn't find too inconvenient at all. This hotel is worth it. It's fun and the evening wine is nice. You can relax at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Sophisticated Feeling But Lowest Priced Rooms Very Small”
Reviews.Author: Abbot71
Reviews.Content: Hotel has formal but friendly customer service, starting with the front door opened for us every time. Hyatt created a chic/sophisticated look with this property which included darkened hallways and nice wine glasses and a corkscrew in each room. Also the 2nd floor terrace had cozy outdoor seating around 2 gas-fireplace pits, where we enjoyed our own wine and snacks while chatting with people who had flown in for winetasting from the Midwest and East Coast. Our experience was mixed, however, for several reasons. First, our room was not ready until almost 5 pm which meant we had to check back 3 different times. After the 2nd time (at 4:15 pm) they offered us a complimentary drink at the bar but it still meant we had the use of a very expensive hotel for less than 18 hours. The room we were given, 226, was extremely small with an uncomfy bed, wafer thin pillows, & two small uncomfy chairs. They also put a premium on the "tub" rooms, which means you only have an oversized "rain" shower in most other rooms but no ability to soak. (Pay for the upgrade if available; they told us they were sold out.) With no hotel pool or spa, they have comp arrangements with the health club next door but that seemed very crowded with community members. Parking on Sundays & holidays is free nearby on the street & also in the police dept lot. There are quite a few good restaurants from low to high price within 5 blocks of the hotel, as well as a Safeway and ATM's.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe V
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great suites and ultra modern decor. Its location is right in the middle of everything in Downtown Napa. Our only snag was with the hotels valet & bellman. Didn't seem they had much of a sense of urgency. Besides that its a solid boutique hotel. Spend the extra money on a suite and you'll get good value. HUGE bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Cathy V
Reviews.Content: All of the staff from the doorman to the people cleaning, were friendly and helpful. This was our second stay at the Avia and we will be back. The rooms are very nice and the breakfast was very good. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgregb
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the urban boutique hotel vibe, similar to, though on a smaller scale, W hotels. The rooms are small, in keeping with the vibe. The lobby was active and often full of younger, hip travelers. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The decor was contemporary and well suited to the overall style. Don't go here for the views, as many of the rooms look out onto downtown Napa roof tops. But when you are in Napa, you really aren't typically sitting around in your room looking out the window, you are out having a good time at the wineries. The parking is in a public garage to the north of the hotel and is a short walk, but nothing terrible. In the evenings, they seem to sponsor wine tasting events from local wineries, which is a good crowd builder. All in all, a great place to stay for it convenience to the downtown Napa tasting rooms, like the John Anthony space next door. BTW, the John Anthony Napa Cab 2007 was really a great wine. Here is our only complaint: On Sunday morning the water was never hot. We assumed that this was due to the fact that the hotel was full and perhaps we chose a common time to shower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the fireplace and the views from our mini balcony”
Reviews.Author: Baltobruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avia this fall as part of my fortieth birthday trip. My wife and I loved the gas fireplace and the mini balcony where we enjoyed sipping some of the wine we purchased during the day. The staff were great and the service topnotch! The rooms were well appointed with a docking station for my iPod, a huge bed with very comfortable sheets. The bathroom while a little small had a great tub and shower. We would stay here again when we go back to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel close to many things”
Reviews.Author: Rockinjla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AVIA Napa over the President's Day Holiday Weekend. This was my first time to Napa so I had no idea what to expect. I really like the style of the hotel... had that boutique feeling to it. Very nice common areas (the outdoor patio on the 2nd floor was really neat!) and loved the fire place sitting area behind the bar. The staff seemed to really go out of their way - the front desk, the bartender (Hunter rocked!), bellmen, etc. They also had free wine tasting that Friday and Saturday night we stayed there which was neat. A few words of caution. We had breakfast that Saturday morning at the hotel restaurant. The food was really good and not overly priced but the service was VERY slow and it took FOREVER (I would say about 30 min from the time we ordered to when it was served). They did come an apologize and the charge was never applied to our room. The other caution I have is DO NOT get a room facing First Street. We had a room on the 2nd floor on the corner of First and more like an alley street (room 234). At 6:30 am Saturday the recycling truck woke us up and we could hear people coming in from a late night out. We also had electrical work outside our room window that woke us up on Monday about 6:45 am. I would try to get a room in the back of hotel and not close to the street. Other nice thing about the hotel was it was close to everything in Napa. Restaurants, bars, shopping, and a Safeway. Also had free self parking! Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Lux Tub Suite is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nikkijo
Reviews.Content: After having a fantastic stay at AVIA in Savannah a few months ago, I knew I wanted to stay at AVIA again for our overnight in Napa. It was my birthday so I decided to spoil myself with the Lux Tub Suite. I highly recommend this room. The hotel has a very modern feel and the rooms are decorated beautifully. I loved the wall color and hardwood floors. We also had a great view of downtown Napa. Thereâ€™s a spacious living area with a comfortable couch and chair, a flat screen TV, and a mini-bar stocked with snacks, drinks, wine glasses, and cork screw. The top shelf in the fridge is open for guest use, but donâ€™t pick up anything on the bottom shelves unless you want to pay for it. The bedroom area has a comfy bed, a second flat screen TV, desk, and bathtub. Yes, the bathtub is in the bedroom but trust me it makes perfect sense. Connecting both the living area and bedroom is a fireplace that makes the room nice and toasty (why bother with the heater?). When youâ€™re in the giant bathtub, you can watch the fireplace and spend the night relaxing. The bathroom has two sinks and an enormous shower with two shower heads. The bath products are great and the shower is wonderful. There is a restaurant downstairs that serves breakfast. While we had a great meal, it was a little pricey for breakfast items. My only complaints are similar to the AVIA in Savannah. The front desk employee we had was accommodating by letting us check in early but was also a little short. The concierge, while nice, I think was judging us a little bit. Yes, we are a younger couple and probably donâ€™t look like we come from money like other guests in Napa, but being in sales I know that doesnâ€™t really mean much. All the restaurants she suggested had entrees priced at less than $15 a person and I was hoping to have a really nice meal for my birthday. Also, all the wineries she suggested were giant and where all the tour busses drop off thousands of people a day. I donâ€™t know, maybe Iâ€™m wrong. Maybe thatâ€™s what most of the guests are looking for and she suggests them to everyone. Also, if you make a reservation with a particular discount code and need to change your reservation, make sure the same discount code is applied to your new reservation. I had originally had a AAA rate with free breakfast but needed to change the date of our stay. Itâ€™s easy to change your reservation online, but they had given me the AAA rate without the breakfast. When I went to check in, I asked about our free breakfast and was informed that I didnâ€™t qualify. After checking my reservations later (the original and the changed date), I saw that the discount code had been changed. Overall, this is a beautiful hotel right in downtown Napa and within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Treat yourself right with a Lux Tub Suite. Free Wi-Fi and parking, valet extra. Note to hotel: Everything was sparkling clean, except for the lightswitch in the bathroom (it was really dirty). Please make sure it gets wiped down too when cleaning the room!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for less in wine country”
Reviews.Author: gocompgo
Reviews.Content: On a busy weekend in Napa with most of the B&Bs bumping up prices and having limited space, Avia turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. The hotel is beautiful, with hard wood floors in the common spaces and the rooms being the highlight. Rooms have every amenity one could ask for: comfortable king beds, direct TV, IPod hook ups, etc. The common outdoor space has two gas fire pits where it's perfect to open your favorite bottle from the day and begin your night. Very friendly and helpful staff. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: anita
Reviews.Content: The location of Avia is perfect for day tripping into the wine country. The valet service is fast and the staff was helpful and caring. We had a standard king room that was smaller than expected. I had asked for a quiet room and we were on the top floor but next to the stairwell, and unfortunately no view. Next time I would ask to be on the other side, looking at the city. We did have an issue with a rumbling noise in our room and management went above and beyond to make us happy! In the lobby there is a place for espresso and pastries if you don't want breakfast, and then you can get wine and drinks there later. A lovely touch was the "water bar" in the lobby, one day it was flavored with cucumbers and one day with citrus. We were pleasantly surprised with breakfast, although extremely slow, it was worth the wait. The kitchen uses all local farms for meat and produce, homemade jellies changed each morning. The "wine away" juice drink was awesome, don't miss it! It's a freshly squeezed, interesting combination of fruits and veggies. At the end of the day the selections of restaurants is incredible. We went to Morimoto's and it was everything you would expect, perfection! We also ate at Norman Rose Tavern across the street and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch without Breaking the Bank.”
Reviews.Author: JPH2
Reviews.Content: We only had one day to visit Napa, and our tour director, Nick suggested we stay here. In heart of downtown Napa, walking distance to many great restaurants and shops. It was clean, modern, and had very comfortable beds. We got a double king room which was perfect for the three of us - for 176/night. Reminded my wife of the "W" hotel. We didn't eat at the restaurant. They have a complimentary gym relationship a block away -.the gym was very large and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous hotel in the heart of Downtown Napa...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMacQueens
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We were on a tour of wine country and our travel companions came across this great boutique hotel. Absolutely loved it. Great rooms and friendly service. Amazing Italian restaurant right across the street. Tempted to stay another night but San Fran was calling so we left but plan to return. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: DanielBeryl
Reviews.Content: Avia is located in downtown Napa with easy walking access to most of Napa's shops and restaurants. Valet parking is available or there is free parking in a garage behind the hotel. The hotel spaces have a sort of cool vibe, somewhat like a W property. Rooms are nicely decorated and have baths with rain showers. Some have fireplaces and balconies. The hotel has a bar and restaurant, but it's necessary to go off property for a health club or spa. Services include a concierge, minibar, room service, turn down, and in room coffee. Although not clear to everyone, the hotel is a Hyatt property and provides Hyatt Gold Passport benefits including earning points and elite amenities. There were no bathrobes in the room, but they are available from housekeeping. All there staff were very friendly and helpful making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi4060
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed and kept, AVIA was perfected placed in the heart of downtown Napa. The staff is the nicest we have ever experienced on our numerous adventures. We stayed there in preparation for our wedding at a nearby winery, and not only did they upgrade our room at no charge, they allowed me in very early to the Tower Suite to have all of my bridesmaids get our hair and make-up done. They sent us two bottles of complimentary champagne, and hosted all of our friends and family exceptionally well. What made the absolute difference: When we arrived back at the hotel on our wedding night, a friend of mine was helping my husband and I with the valet cart filled with our extra wine and our friend spilled a glass of red all over the front of my beautiful wedding gown. AVIA came to the rescue and spent all of the next day sending it to various places to get the wine removed, again complimentary. I cannot say enough great things about our stay. From the prompt and gregarious nature of the charming valet, the overall ambiance, to all of the nearby dining and shopping, I will always stay here when I frequent Napa. It is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: Klo98
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. Friendly staff. Great location. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: SARXMAN
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased. From the upgrade to Master Bath Suite (you gotta check it out!) to the impeccable service with every attention to detail to the perfect location, we could not have asked for more! They even shipped our wine purchases for half of what UPS was going to do. Excellent proximity (within walking distance) to most of the major restaurants. I would HIGHLY recommend the AVIA for your next stay in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: nootied
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern, great service, affordable. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! The location is unbeatable.”
Reviews.Author: Lawgurl126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew down for a Thursday through Sunday trip for my birthday. We upgraded to a room with a soaking tub. Everyone and everything was great. Everyone knew our names and we were even surprised with a complimentary bottle of champagne to toast my birthday in our room when we checked in. The fire pits on the second floor terrace were my favorite part. I think you would have to be super picky/snobby to not like this place. We would recommend this place to anyone. We would highly recommend booking a tour with Bruce at Wine Country Safari, also. It's well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions...”
Reviews.Author: Lilyee
Reviews.Content: On the one hand, the hotel was smart, modern and our room spacious - on the other hand we were annoyed by a few things that will prevent us from returning to Avia. We were greeted coolly by the reception staff but enjoyed our light dinner in the restaurant. The chef, a new addition to the staff, was very friendly and prepared a great meal. The waiter was very efficient, polite and helpful with menu choices. The decor in the lounge/ restaurant was beautiful. The room itself was fine although I don't get the mini bar rigged with pressure sensors! Why treat guests as potential thieves from the first moment they enter their room? You either provide a mini bar with a limited selection or you take it away. Don't rig the tray and the fridge with sensor monitors - it's insulting. Our room was located directly opposite a meeting room so we were woken at about 6.00am by staff preparing for the 8.00am meeting. We only stayed one night but had housekeeping ringing our doorbell at 8.15am. Not good enough. Next time we will stay at St Helena and give Napa a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Clumsy Design, Service and Room”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a few times at the Avia and am consistently annoyed with the many little flaws. Here are what I consider design and service flaws. 1. Desk in room has no outlet by it. 2. NO SOUNDPROOFING (the windows are like paper/hardwood floors echo) 3. Seating is AWFUL. Chairs in the room and very low to the ground and uncomfortable. Chairs in the lobby are narrow and generally not good to sit in. This includes the restaurant, the bar and every other space. The chairs may be stylish but are not functional. 4. The bar only serves wine and beer (often improperly chilled) 5. The granola breakfast is portioned so small you could be jealous of an airline breakfast. It consists of about 4 tablespoons of yogurt, 1 spoonful of granola and a 1/3 of a pear. 6. They only pour 1/2 cups of coffee at breakfast. 7. At the restaurant consistently you have hiccups, no cream for coffee, dinner menu not breakfast and staff ignoring you. 8. The bartender did not have a clue about wine defects as they served flawed wines. (We are in Napa, hello!) 9. The wine list is poorly conceived (Random foreign selections limited and usually very commercial local selections that lack any inspiration) 10. The bar did not have a second bottle of wine we ordered even though it was on the by the glass list also. (Silly and mindless) The few positives point at this hotel are location, the bedding quality and a nice bathroom. Beyond that I am rather disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A good last minute weekend spot for Napa”
Reviews.Author: OCPB
Reviews.Content: This weekend decided at the last minute to head up to Napa for the night. Not enough of an "event weekend" to stay at my usual but still wanted to be comfortable. We decided based on our excellent experiences with Avia Savannah and Avia Long Beach to give this one a try. It is a nice little hotel, very conveniently located in downtown Napa so that you can easily walk to dinner or out for cocktails. The room was comfy and fairly spacious - we were upgraded to a room with a great bathtub (HUGE) but didn't get a chance to try that out. I will say it looked amazing because you could lay in the bathtub and watch tv - nice! My only complaint would be the view from the room was pretty atrocious - we were looking out at the roof with all the air conditioning units out one window and into the parking garage from the other so it did make it a bit of a concrete jungle BUT I would still recommend this as a good less expensive spot to stay for some time in wine country. Restaurant looked nice but we didn't make it in there - the evening bar was lovely and the very friendly bartender even went next door to grab a decanter for our wine. All in all a good and very economical experience. There are fire pits and a large outdoor seating area but as it was raining quite hard this weekend, we didn't get a chance to try it...but next time! Staff very friendly and that was consistent with the other Avia properties we have tried.

Reviews.Title: “Avia - Great find !! Thank you, tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Naresh1410
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 looking for a good hotel in Napa, and thanx to the reviews here, I booked Avia, and it turned out to be a great find. The rooms are fab, and I got great rates from hotels.com. The only negative point about the hotel was noise. If you get a room facing the back ( garage ) even on the 5th floor ( I had 519 ) the room heating and a possible heating motor in their backyard was very noisy. I was too tired to change my room, but my friends did. So dont take odd no rooms here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MaryLouise53
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, parking is free, staff is very friendly, concierge is well informed. We attended a free wine tasting and spent a nice evening at the outdoor fire pit. At the foot of wine country in the town of Napa, this hotel is walking distance to some interesting shops and some fantastic restaurants. Many of the bars have happy hours and wine tastings. All of the wineries in Napa and Sonoma are a short drive away. I loved the location and would definitely return. There are less expensive places to stay but the Avia worked best for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Napa”
Reviews.Author: jls6860
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with friends this past weekend to Napa Valley for a wine tasting weekend. We had been setup at a private house to stay in for the weekend- when we got to the house we realized this house would not work. Well we looked up hotels and the Avia ( now owned by Hyatt) came up. We spoke to Amy at the front she got us in rooms- lux suites. It was a holiday weekend and they were close to sold out. We got to the hotel- and we're thrilled to find it- we were blown away. The hotel was great happening, and in the darling area of Napa. It has all been redone. There were great places to eat and very nice tasting rooms. All walking distance to the hotel . We got up the next morning to have breakfast at the hotel it was fantastic menu! That night after a long day of tours we came back to enjoy the terrace- large wonder fire pits one with rockers and one with a living room feel. We also noticed everyone that works at this hotel was friendly and helpful. We can't wait to go back! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - say no more”
Reviews.Author: Liv111
Reviews.Content: The greeting in the reception and the check in was super. We stayed over christmas and had a wonderful time. The rooms where super nice and clean and very well kept. The breakfast was a treat and very nicely presented. The concierge where very helpful and arranged a lovely wine tour for the whole family. If you ask you can get tickets to the gym which is just next door. I did a christmas day spinning very fun. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Napa at a decent rate with fabulous amenities”
Reviews.Author: SDTravelerUSC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Avia Napa with a group of friends for a girls weekend and we absolutely loved everything about this hotel. I will definitely stay there next time I go to Napa. Thanks to the staff for a wonderful experience. The rooms are beautiful and the location was perfect for us to be able to walk to dinner (highly recommend Carpe Diem a few blocks away). Perks included a good rate booked directly theough the hotel, the free wi-fi, and free business center services, the fireplace in the room, fabulous big shower with an awesome rainfall type showerhead, and a great complimentary upgrade because the type of room we reserved was overbooked accidentally. Pamela at the concierge desk was great and we loved Sasha at the front desk and really appreciated the service they provoded and their genuine friendly demeanor. Definitely stop by the concierge desk before wine tasting--they hooked us up with several two-for-one tasting coupons at wineries that were recommended based on our wine preferences.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: pattisonr
Reviews.Content: Downtown Napa has in recent years become a much more fun and interesting place, and AVIA offers a lovely experience there with the feel of a much smaller boutique hotel. It is within walking distance of many good restaurants, shops and local art. The rooms are excellent, roomy, comfortable, and quiet, very nicely appointed and clean. We often find staying at hotels in and around Napa as just places to sleep for the night, but AVIA was much more comfortable than that. Friendly, attentive staff. We welcomed the new year in the bar with two other couples we met there and a wonderful bartender. We really enjoyed our stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Louisiana Lagniappe in Napa”
Reviews.Author: dileo
Reviews.Content: Being from New Orleans, we appreciate nice hotels and good meals. This hotel is an excellent choice for Napa. The rates were very reasonable considering how nice the rooms were. We were going to stay at a more exclusive resort, but we decided to stay downtown within walking distance to some good restaurants. We put the money we saved on a hotel to have a limo pick us up to enjoy the vineyards and other restaurants. The staff at the Avia were very friendly, breakfast was very good, and the rooms were very clean. ---- you can't go wrong staying here- -----one more thing------The rooms had hardwood floors which made it feel more inviting and CLEAN

Reviews.Title: “Good location and home base for visiting Napa”
Reviews.Author: Klimbamountain
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hospitality and location. Very easy location as we walked to local downtown attractions. Front desk was nice and was helpful. We did not have a chance to use the hotel's amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Little hotel with a big bang”
Reviews.Author: ccinchico
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed in this hotel last March and forgot to review it. That said this is a beautiful piece of property with every amenity you can think of...EXCEPT the cork screw? I stayed in the suite and the pass through fire place was delightful. We had a small living area and a large bedroom. I do have to say that they pass off the tub in the middle of the room as romantic but it was a bit odd. Great deep tub though! The bathroom is fantastic. Beautiful HUGE shower. The patio area outside our room was delightful with its fireplace and cocktail (wine) service! The service was attentive. As stated the only downfall is there were wine glasses in the room with no opener! Great Napa stay in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nicely furnished rooms”
Reviews.Author: pallavis4
Reviews.Content: Loved the location...everything was walking distance.The rooms were really nicely done up. Our room had a nice bath tub ( in the room)- I loved it!! The only thing missing was a pool & spa tub.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, big room and now managed by Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: AussieBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: In the centre of town close to lots of restaurants, food stores and of course wine bars. We got a Harvest Suite which was very big and had a nice gas fireplace that doubled to both the lounge and bedroom. Only complaintsnwould be that the room was really dark, the valet had us waiting every time even though we gave 30 mins notice and room device took an hour to arrive. Otherwise room was lovely, location great, and we'll priced.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding choice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Wynterhk2
Reviews.Content: As a travel professional, I have had the opportunity to visit the best of the best all over the world... AVIA ranks in the top 10 percent of all the hotels I have experienced. Rooms are modern, but not austere, with every detail considered for maximum convience and comfort. Ample space and luxe bedding. Great location. Knowledgable staff, competent and helpful. On a scale of 1-10.., this hotel gets a solid 9 plus.. I would rate a 10, but then again, everyone needs a little prompting to go the extra distance. Room 430 corner bathtub mini suite is PERFECTION. I can think of nothing I can critique. GO, STAY, ENJOY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pleasure in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: carcam36
Reviews.Content: As I had to travel to Napa Valley for business, I decided to bring together my wife and get the most out of it. Based on a close friend's tip, I stayed at this hotel, which at first seemed unappealing, as I thought of the country side near Napa as the best choice for a hotel. I am glad we went there. The hotel is located at the heart of the city within walking distance of several interesting restaurants. The lobby, its bar and restaurant are all cozy and comfortable. The rooms are nice, and since we got an upgrande, ours was amazing! Everything was in place and we enjoyed it immensely.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place and price is reasonable for the area!”
Reviews.Author: m4rcla
Reviews.Content: I heard about this hotel from a friend of mine who stayed there and raved about it. The price was quite reasonable for the Napa area, and I LOVED the modern style of the hotel. This hotel had just recently been acquired by Hyatt, previously the name was just "Avia Napa." Even though this hotel was now technically a Hyatt hotel, we didn't really feel like we were staying in a chain hotel. The hotel still retained a lot of its "boutique" feel which we liked. The hotel is located in downtown Napa. We have been to Napa a number of times, but surprisingly haven't been to this area of town. The hotel is on a quiet street area, across shops and restaurants. It was nice to be able to walk around and check out downtown Napa from our hotel. One thing to note, we thought that the parking was valet only ($15/night). We had a lot of luggage for our stay :p so decided to valet. On the second day did we realize that we could have actually self parked at the parking garage in the back for free. We booked the hotel via hotels.com and after reading many reviews on Trip Advisor, we splurged and booked the Master Tub Suite. The Master Tub Suite had a separate living room area, as well as a HUGE tub. :) The room was quite spacious, and there were actually 2 flat screen TVs (one in the living room and another one in the bedroom). The bedroom area was beautiful! There was a HUGE tub to the side of the room, which was very unique and so lovely! The tub was GIGANTIC! If we ever build our own house, I would want a tub like that! The bathroom area was also really spacious, with a separate shower area and dual his/her sinks. There wasn't a swimming pool in this hotel, which I thought was a little surprising. But we didn't mind since we only stayed for one night. Their evening turndown service was a nice touch, which included 2 free bottled waters and mini chocolates. The hotel also provided free drinks/appetizers in the lobby area from 5:30-7:00 PM nightly as well as free chair massages. How awesome is that? Unfortunately, we were not able to participate since we had early dinner reservations at 5:30 PM. Overall we LOVED this hotel and would definitely consider staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LAXbuzz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel. They were very helpful when I wanted to have a room that we had a previous time. They couldn't give us that particularly room but one like it. They had massages in the foyer and wine and cheese. It was great. The location is amazing right in Downtown Napa. We had breakfasts included in our rate and they were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: finediningbreathing
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Rooms are awesome and wine bar nice. Found it on trip advisor. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice option in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a recent trip to Sonoma and Napa to visit wineries. Many of the other hotels in both towns were booked full or overpriced - many also required at least two-night stays. The Avia Napa is owned by Hyatt Hotels and was less expensive, more attractive modern boutique hotel decor, and didn't require more than a one night stay. The room was a bit small but modern and chic. Wifi was free. Bathroom was large and nice. Nice toiletries. Valet parking was ok - a little slow on the pick up after checking out. I also think they should have had free coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Avia Hotel a nice base for traveling Napa and Sonoma.”
Reviews.Author: Mishamee
Reviews.Content: Hotel was modern, clean and close to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: mobie0309
Reviews.Content: We got a steal of a deal for Thanksgiving so no complaints about what we got for the $. Very nice room with double fireplace and comfortable bed. It is true what others said about potential noise if you are by elevators and there were very few staying at the hotel. Fire pit on the terrace was a nice touch. Very convenient to park the car and walk to shops and restaurants. Have stayed at the Avia in Savannah, GA - equally nice! Also good to have a hotel where you can open the windows!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorothyanne58
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel,very friendly staff and comfortable rooms;the terrace with open pit fires was a lovely place to relax in the evening with a bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: reillyran
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, easy walk to the restaurants and shops. Free self parking in back. Wine bar in the lobby. Staff is great. We upgraded to a LUX Suite: 1 King Bed:Studio Suite:Living area w/sofa Oversized shower with waterfall shower. The room was modern, blackout drapes were a plus. We enjoyed the fireplace. Plenty of room for two. What I didn't like is that we were put by the elevator, and it got loud. We could also hear people on the street so this may not be a big problem now, it could a problem for some at peak season. The bed was mushy, thankfully I didn't wake up with a back ache, so Hyatt it's time to change the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Avia Napa - A nice retreat”
Reviews.Author: enton1512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avia Napa at the end of September. The hotel is conveniently located to in downtown Napa. You can walk to many restaurants and bars locally. The rooms are spotless and should you choose there is no need to leave the hotel as they have a nice restaurant and nice terrace with a fireplace. It is located on the 2nd floor. The hotel does not have a pool or a fitness center. However, the hotel provides passes for the gym next door. Overall we had a good stay at Avia Napa. The concierges (two women) were very nice and helpful and made the stay more enjoyable with their tips for a massage place and wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Whoops”
Reviews.Author: lacortec
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but not the napa experience the website leads you to think you are getting. It has a feel of a trendy Courtyard by Marriott rathern than a quiet oasis. I suggest staying further up 29. The rooms were small, the hotel was loud and there were too many staff. I know that sounds odd but every time you left or came back to the hotel they were in your face. The only thing that was great was the short walk to the Bounty Hunter for Beer Can Chicken and awesome wine selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: CPBHTX
Reviews.Content: Have been to NV many times and have never stayed inside Napa city. Checked out many other hotels but they were all booked. Was reluctant to stay in Napa as it is so far south but was glad we did. The hotel is in downtown Napa and is in a very good location. Liked the rooms and the price ($339 and $369 a night - stayed four nights). It is now a Hyatt property but operates like a boutique hotel. They arranged car service, ordered picnic lunch, and made restaurant reservations. No surprises, just good service and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: smotteman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Napa Valley for our honeymoon this past summer. We chose Avia based off their website and the reviews on trip advisor, but I was more than surprised by how much I could be impressed when I got there. First the location is perfect, right in the middle of downtown within walking distant of all those local attractions. The hotel itself is gorgeous. We stayed in one of the deluxe king suites I believe it was called and it was perfect, lots of room with very modern attributes which I loved. The hotel has several dining rooms and and outdoor veranda which is amazing in the evening. Some of the things I loved about the hotel was how many events and little things they had going on while we were there. We attended a radio hosted part on the outdoor landing and met some great people. The staff was extremely friendly, there was always someone new to chat with. Finally, my favorite service the hotel offered was a concierge. I don't think they have the company through the hotel, but the fact that the hotel has that available is amazing!!! With the wedding planning, the honeymoon wasn't very high on the priority list, my husband and I just wanted to relax. The concierge Julia met with us a few times and really got to know us in order to make great recommendations. She also shared with us several cards that gave free wine tastings or other benefits. She arranged all of our tours and appointments. Our trip would not have been as memorable without her. Overall, a wonderful experience. My husband and I are planning on going back to stay at Avia for our 5 year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Napa”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: Great location, incredible concierge, good service, although weekend breakfast staff was slow. Food was good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avia Napa - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thirsty-traveler07
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it appeared to be in a good location for our wine country vacation and it looked updated and modern. We loved it! The room was really nice, with hardwood floors, and a great bathroom. We were on the 2nd floor, which is also the same floor where the terrace is located. Our room had a living/sitting area with an actual comfy couch; there was a tv in the sitting area and one in the sleeping area. We were quite impressed! Free parking attached to the hotel, but you do have to walk outside to get from the lot to the hotel, but the weather was great, and they have valet if you choose not to self park. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love Avia”
Reviews.Author: JoanneHagger
Reviews.Content: A great trip for my 40th birthday. Concierge desk helped us book a driver for 2 days so we could taste the best of napa and Sonoma. Our driver was an ex wine maker with incredible knowledge of the area and took us to great small wineries which we wouldn't have found ourselves. The room was lovely and the staff were very helpful. Great Italian restaurant opposite hotel and incredible BBQ (bounty hunter) just up the road. Would love to return! Thank you Avia.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely modern hotel in downtown Napa!!”
Reviews.Author: gurng
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in early October. First time in Napa and in this hotel! The interiors are very beautiful- casual modern elegance. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the bed afforded a good nights sleep. We took advantage of the outdoor terrace on the second floor-they have a small bar in the late afternoon, and firepits you can sit around when the sun goes down. Very peaceful. Staff was friendly overall, the manager even chatted with us and took our picture with our camera, as we were sitting around in the late evening in the lobby bar area. Only criticism was slowwwww service the moring as we ate breakfast in the fairly empty restaurant. Food was fine though. Location is nice- can walk to restauants in downtown Napa from hotel. (don't miss Celadon). Hope to be back one day Avia!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel to use as "Home Base" in Napa”
Reviews.Author: HopsHunter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days while exploring the region. Convenient location, concierge is helpful. Rooms are modern, clean; but our king-bed room was a bit small. Didn't mind too much, since we in the valley all day. Parking garage is convenient. Rain shower in bathroom was great. Wish they had big screen TV in their lounge to watch World Series. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent Hyatt property in Napa Valley - as a Diamond Member - No regrets, Can't Wait To Return!!”
Reviews.Author: sully911
Reviews.Content: Picked via Nichole, my Hyatt concierge. Being new to the Hyatt group, she was not familiar with Avia (Napa, LA area, The Woodlands and Savannah). Last hotel in Napa city proper was crappy. This hotel was FAB. Right in the middle of a blossoming new downtown Napa. Free self-park, restaurants galore, serene property - a mix of an Andaz, and W Hotel with pure wine country flair. Room was deluxe tub suite. A bit small but the fireplace and large bath were winners. 2nd floor Firepit is lively and lovely place to bring a glass of the wine you just acquired. Dining - comp break buffet. Also has full service restaurant with sat buffet. Comped for Hyatt Diamond. Planning a reason to do business here just to stay at this property again!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to staying here again---soon!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaHarpist
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this wonderful hotel in September and could not have been more pleased. The location was great, the room was spacious, clean, well appointed, and very comfortable. We also enjoyed the food. Breakfast was excellant, and after a big lunch while touring the valley we appreciated the wondrful "small plates" offered at the restauant for dinner.The staff was very friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated the information and tips we received from the two concierges we dealt with during our stay. The frosting on the cake for us was sitting around the fire pit on the terrace in the evening, with a wine we found that day, chatting with other couples about how the day had gone.

Reviews.Title: “overall good stay rated very poor so i could share my thoughts”
Reviews.Author: staciebc
Reviews.Content: EXCELENT EXPERIENCE BUT PEOPLE NEED TO READ ABOUT THE HOTEL FIRST AND A BIT IMPROVEMENT PLEASE READ!! my husband and i stayed for a quick getaway during harvest and we where uncertain after reading the bad reviews But it was good stay!!! and yes we could not check in early but WE asked when we booked and were advised to call early the day of and that is ok there was other guests making a big scandal about it IF ONLY PEOPLE WOULD READ THEIR EMAIL CONFIRMATION THAT BY THE WAY MENTIONS THE CHARGE FOR VALET,SELF PARKING,CHECK IN AND CHECK OUT TIMES WE WOULD ALL HAVE A SMOOTH CHECK IN PROCESS YES MAYBE THE FRONt DESK PERSONALPaul was very helpful during our stay yet sarcastic during our check out!! Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...Elegant & Refined, Yet Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the first weekend of the Fall Harvest and it was certainly a great decision! The rooms were spacious, the beds were comfortable, big showers, internet, etc. The location was ideal - as it was very close to many restaurants, cafes, shopping and more -- which was perfect for our mornings (so often, you are in an isolated location and can only dine @ the hotel) -- or late evenings. The staff is very friendly and especially the bartenders. They allowed us to enjoy some of our own wine that we had purchased in Napa and also had great knowledge of wines they were serving at the bar -- advised us or suggested some great wines when we were ordering some early afternoon glasses of wine. I can't remember the gentleman's name, but he worked the evening shift and was just great! Stayed and chatted with us well beyond when he was supposed to leave and enabled us to continue our great night at the hotel's bar! Lovely! We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: sundevil731
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Avia Hotel for our 1 year anniversary and had a very enjoyable time. For those that are not looking for the traditional B&B in Napa then this is place to stay if you want a newer and clean hotel. A+ location right on 1st street walking distance to all the great restaurants, Oxbow Market, and shopping. The only downside was our room was quite small but the large bathroom with walk in shower made up for the tight room size. Definitely worth the stay if you are looking for a downtown location and the complimentary tastings at night were quite nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: debgm123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 2 nights and really loved everything about the hotel. The only negative was that we were only able to stay 2 nights. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were so nice and quiet. The outdoor patio is beautiful. We were able to walk to dinner both nights. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Clean and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Casey D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it is a great place to stay! The food is VERY reasonable, rooms are very nice and clean! Every time I come back to Napa I will be staying at this hotel! Great location too! We walked to all the restaurants from there.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ree-Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avia Napa for 4 nights in October. For the price paid, this is definitely not somewhere I would recommend. I'll start with the pros: The hotel has free parking in the garage behind the street and is within walking distance to restaurants. In addition, the staff was really nice. They did do everything they could to make the stay pleasant. Here are the cons: We reserved a Lux Suite Balcony room (Room 317). I was really looking forward to having a room with a balcony. Unfortunately, our balcony suite overlooked the concrete wall of a parking garage. It was definitely not worth the extra money that I paid. I have no idea why this hotel would sell balcony rooms with no view. The room itself was a good size, but getting a little worn (couch had pulls in it). No bathrobes in the room, we had to call down to get some stocked. I'm not sure how those could be missed as part of a room cleaning and preparation, but they were. In fact, for 2 nights we didn't have them. But the worst part of the room was the horrible sewerage smell in the bathroom. It got worse at certain times of the day, but it was really awful. I mentioned this to the front desk on my second day, but nothing changed, nor did anyone provide me with any feedback that they had looked into it. The restaurant had a great breakfast, but the service was really slow. This was a management issue, I cannot blame the servers for this. They were understaffed, and could not get keep up with the demand. It took 10 minutes just to seat us for breakfast. There were lots of open tables, just no one to set them. It then took 10 minutes to just get coffee. Just a really bad experience overall. When I checked out I was asked how my stay was. When I explained the above, the gentleman at the front desk wrote everything down and was extremely nice, and asked if it was okay if his Manager emailed me. I told him that I would be more than happy to discuss this with the Manager. No email was sent. As I said before, I see this hotel as having a Management issue. This just confirms that. The Avia is trying to be an upscale hotel, and certainly charges the prices, but falls short on many aspects. There are better values in Napa. My recommendation is to find one.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: MAWilbur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the suggestion of a friend and it was GREAT! The hotel location is walking distance to numerous restaruants, all very good. We were picked up at the door by our tour guide, we used Playtpus Tours one day for Napa one day for Sonoma - GREAT. The staff was nice and helpful, breakfast was delicious approx. $30 for two adults. The rooms were sleek and modern, kind of small but very nice, very clean, bathrooms roomy and luxiourious. I would highly recommend this hotel for any Napa visitor and would stay again. Another place to venture to is Yonksville (sp) and St. Helena they were both pretty little towns with lots of nice shops, spas, restaurants, Calistogia (sp) was just okay ! - go for mud bath but don't stay up there.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: rwsdsc1
Reviews.Content: We had one of the two rooms with a private(huge) balcony.It is worth the upgrade. Bed great, TV awsome, Shower amazing. Room is paradise while in wine country. This is a a hip and contemporay hotel so do not look for antiques. Also try the French restaurant across the street it starts with an O.

Reviews.Title: “slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: george2455
Reviews.Content: when you view some of the pictures on the website they do not really reflect the size of the rooms. we booked a master tub suite. when we arrived we were slightly disappointed in the actual size of the room. to be honest they could probably make more use of the space by getting rid of the tub...ours was huge! when you add in to the equation that the hotel is not exactly cheap, that is what makes it disappointing. the staff were friendly and helpful and it was a very relaxed atmosphere. to sum up it wasn't bad but it wasn't good either

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations! Maybe mine are too high?”
Reviews.Author: msblueyz
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at the newly branded Hyatt Avia in Napa. Based on the pictures on the Hyatt and former Avia web sites, along with numerous Yelp and Trip Advisor reviews, we thought we were making a great choice of accommodation in Napa. My husband is a Hyatt Diamond Passport so our expectations are always high. I had called the hotel manager about a week before the conversion to Hyatt (September 1st was their "live" date) asking if we could book using our Diamond suite upgrade awards for two nights and pay for the rest. She was very accommodating in obtaining a suite for us during high season. Check in was smooth although the front desk is not quite Hyatt-savvy. The front desk agent was very kind, but really neglected to give us the dog and pony show to which we have become accustomed, especially when it is our first stay at a particular property. Although the manager was helpful with making the reservation, I really believed that as Diamond Passport, they would have pulled out all the stops for us. Not! Not even a welcome letter in our suite! The front desk agent said we have already blocked you a great room! Ha! We were given the lowest level of suite (a lux suite) with a view of the parking lot behind the property! It was also right next to the elevators! It would have been an insult to any Hyatt Diamond. It is important to note that this property is not a view property and a "premium" view would be overlooking First Street in downtown Napa, and maybe, it might have a balcony . . . Ours didn't. Fortunately for us, we didn't need a view or a balcony, but for those who want to have accommodations that overlook the vineyards, gardens or even a pool or water feature, this is not the place for you! On the positive side, the property has a lovely patio area with fire pits where you can order your wine or BYOB and enjoy the crisp air in the evenings and relax after a long day of wine tasting. The hotel also offers some wine tasting events in the evening, a plus if you want even more wine. Service was good, but not great. The concierge was definitely on her game when she was able to get us a much-coveted appointment at Pride Vineyards! I would definitely rely on their concierges for any and all information you might need. There was otherwise very little in personal attention for this boutique hotel. Our suite was sweet, but nothing about which I could rave as others have previously done in their reviews. The bathroom does have a quasi walk-in shower with a rain shower head, but unless you tilt it towards the wall, all the water overflows onto the bathroom floor. You don't even realize it until you step out into a huge puddle! In our bathroom, the toilet faced the windows, so if the drapes were open and you forgot to close the sliding bathroom door, the entire parking lot can see you squat! In addition, the web site shows a lux suite with double sinks, but in ours, there was only one! Breakfast service is very slow. We waited ten minutes for our server to offer us coffee. The weekend buffet is, however, lovely with lots of options including yummy hot items and an egg and omelet station. The applewood smoked bacon and chicken apple sausage are delish! The location is perfect for exploring downtown Napa which has had a massive revitalization since our last visit over six years ago. You can walk to great markets, eclectic shops, wine tasting stores and fabulous four-star restaurants. I think that is the Hyatt Avia's strongest selling point since it definitely does NOT have any of the following amenities that one associates with the typical wine country experience. Nothing near the quaintness and personality of a bed and breakfast or small inn. No luxurious grounds to meander. No spa, although they do have privileges with the fitness center next door. No pool. No hot tub. For $400 per night (that is what we paid for a SUNDAY night stay), I think you can get a lot more bang for your buck in Napa Valley. We were so enamored by the fact that Hyatt finally had a property in the Napa Valley (they have a Hyatt in Santa Rosa which is too far from the main attractions) that I forgot to do my homework! When we returned home, I looked up some of the rates and amenities of comparable properties, like the Westin Napa, and found the rates very similar for the last weekend in October, and the Westin has its own fitness facility, outdoor pool and spa. Are we too spoiled? I think not, given that we stay pretty much exclusively at Hyatt unless there isn't a convenient location. We have expect a certain level of bend over backward-ness as Hyatt Diamond guests. In conclusion, I would by no means discount the Hyatt Avia as a contender when deciding on a property in the Napa area of the Wine Country, but I would seriously consider what amenities are offered before I plunked down my credit card guarantee!

Reviews.Title: “excellent in many ways”
Reviews.Author: BN712
Reviews.Content: Here are a few ways in which Avia Napa met and exceeded my expectations: *Room was very well appointed and clean. The hotel is beautifully decorated throughout. *Concierge was very helpful with recommending some excellent boutique wineries (and making our appointments at the wineries). *Complimentary access to a large fitness facility next door. *Breakfast was delicious. They had a full gourmet buffet on offer, but the waitstaff allowed us to dine a la carte. We selected just an item or two from the buffet and were billed only for those items and coffee, which was a much more economical option for us. The waitstaff were very accomodating. *Great location in downtown Napa ~ walking distance to art galleries, restaurants, shops and the Oxbow Market (***highly recommended***). *Free self-parking. Valet also available. *Friendly greetings from all hotel personnel.
