Very clean and well kept. The Vintners Suite is the best room at the hotel. 1000 sq ft, well designed, and well appointed with the exception of the lack of microwave. C'mon, really? Its got a 10' wet bar there...but no microwave? And what ever you do, dont even TOUCH any of the items in the wetbar unless you want the charge to show up on your room bill. The front desk asked if we had actually used the trail mix we touched but removed the charge without further discussion as soon as we said no. Fireplace, soaking tub, walk in door less shower, great lighting, private patio, separate bedroom, and everything you would expect in a 5 star hotel. In fact, this hotel/room easily ranks among any of the 5 star hotels we have stayed at. You can easily pay far more for much less in Napa. If your considering this hotel, get off the fence and book it. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Without Some of the Frills”
Reviews.Author: NDGirlInCali
Reviews.Content: What is AVIA Hotel? It's trendy and modern with lots of dark wood and sleek lines located in downtown Napa within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. It has a nice (but small) bar/lounge area with plush seating and cozy leather wingback chairs tucked away to the side. The Master Tub Suite is very roomy with a separate sitting and sleeping area with a nice double sided gas fireplace. There is a massive tub next to the bed (which I thought was a little weird but others might enjoy) and an enormous shower big enough for 4 or more with waterfall shower head. What is AVIA Hotel not? It is not a relaxing quaint stay among the vineyards. It is also not quite a luxury hotel. There is no onsite fitness center or spa. Both are provided by partnership businesses nearby. Self parking is in a detached parking garage which isn't all that far away - of course you can valet. And our room overlooked said parking garage. And this is being nit-picky but the bathroom door slides shut and isn't a true door. I find this annoying. Overall this is a wonderful hotel and very nice...but if I'm going to wine country I prefer a B&B or resort that has more onsite amenities. But if you want more nightlife and bar options at night (Napa/Sonoma has very limited nighttime activities) this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the President's Day weekend in a Master Tub Suite. We had registered on line for an upgrade to the Harvest Suite, but this being a holiday weekend I'm not surprised that we couldn't get the upgrade. The Master Tub Suite suited our purposes just fine. The suite is just as it appears on the website. The bathroom is very nice, the bed is very comfortable and the fire place does a nice job heating up the room. We were on the fourth floor in a quiet room (one window looked into a wall, the other overlooked the hotel's terrace area). It is a shame the weather wasn't great because it would have been nice to take advantage of the terrace, which looks beautiful. We had no issues whatsoever with housekeeping, our room was clean and every day we had enough towels, soap etc etc. We had room service (hamburgers and fries) the first night there and we were pleasantly surprised at how good it was. The next morning we had the buffet breakfast, which was also very good. Our waiter was extremely attentive, as was the lady custom making our omelettes. Other hotels would charge much more than the $17.00 (or so) that the AVIA charged for the buffet. Check in and check out was a smooth process. The only glitch (charged for something on the mini bar that we didn't use), was fixed quickly with no issue at all. The valet service was also very efficient. We are a pretty picky couple, and we have stayed in several of the higher end inns and hotels in Napa/Sonoma where the rooms cost 2-3x times a night. For the money, this hotel is an excellent value, and it is in a good location. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: kamaelb
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Avia hotel was my best stay at a hotel ever !!!! From the moment I walked in I felt welcomed. Tthe staff was Amazing and at the front desk Pierre went above and beyond to give me recomendations to local attractions and eateries. He even went as far as printing information from his personal computer behind the front desk. The rooms at the Avia are very modern, beautiful and are very relaxing.. Highly recomended and Thank you to Pierre at the front desk for all of the help.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: AnnikaFL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel in January 2011. We didn't really know what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised when we walked through the doors. There was a lovely fireplace going in the lounge and we got upgraded without even asking! The fireplace in the room was my favorite part and warmed up the room so quickly and made such a cozy/romantic atmosphere! The only meals we ate there was breakfast, but it was delicious! We were able to walk to all the shops/restaurants in downtown and was just a short drive to the wineries so it was convenient. The only small issue I had was the hair dryer in the room broke and it took a while to get a new one sent up, but they were very apologetic! I have told all my friends to stay there on their next trip to Napa and they won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Beautiful property.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSoccerMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and had a very nice stay. We were upgraded to a Luxury Tub Suite (I'd sent an email letting them know it was our anniversary) and the room was lovely. The hotel is very new and the the staff was very friendly. We never at on property, but the menu looked good. It's in a perfect location in newly growing downtown Napa. There are so many restaurants & shops nearby. We spent one whole day just wandering around. The pricing was very reasonable - of course we were there in off season, so I'm sure it's more during harvest, but it was just perfect. The only reason I didn't give service an excellent rating was no one mentioned the upgrade or our anniversary upon check in. I had to call the property the day before to confirm they'd gotten my email from a few weeks prior about our anniversary and the person said they had received it and that they'd upgraded us. That was very lovely, but you would have thought they would have also said something to us at check in? But really, overall it was a great time. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: FCT3
Reviews.Content: We frequently go to Napa, and this hotel is our new favorite. The location is very convenient to downtown shops and restaurants, and many are in walking distance. The common areas are very clean, as are the rooms. The rooms are also spacious and comfortable, with excellent beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: CafeBohemia
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with excellent service. Great central location in downtown Napa close to tons of fine restaurants. Service was exemplary. I was upgraded to a huge really comfortable modern suite on arrival (it was quiet) with a nice view of the valley hills. Cool terrace with firepit in the central courtyard. Nice lobby bar with complimentary wine for a couple of hours in the evening. Free parking at the adjacent garage. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work!”
Reviews.Author: skwimmer
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and modern; clean; comfortable rooms except chair at computer table must be meant for children only. Front desk is not very helpful. We requested well in advance for a room with feather-free bedding. When we arrived, we reiterated the feather-free info to them and were told we should of done that when we made the reservation. I pointed out to the desk clerk that it was so noted on the paper he had me sign about not smoking in the rooms and no pets. The clerk and several others scrambled to find us a feather free room, first saying room 515 then 432 and finally putting us in 335. Shortly after we got to the room there was a knock on the door. There stood a guy struggling to hang onto four feather-free pillows. We were also told after parking a block or so away that we should not have parked on the ground floor of the parking garage but on the third floor. None of this info was told to us at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Avia Napa. Great hotel with great staff in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jeapark
Reviews.Content: Positive experience at hotel started even before my stay. There was a glitch in the online reservation from hotel.com. Contacted the hotel to make changes. Spoke with Laurie, one of the managers, who was very helpful. She listened to the problem, made necessary changes, and kept all the promises she said she would. Not only that, but upon arriving at the hotel room, a personalized, hand-written card was waiting for me from Laurie. Was a great way to start a vacation and see that great customer service still exists. The staff upon check-in was very friendly and helpful when asked about restaurant recommendations. The room was very clean and nice. The bed was comfortable. Will definitely recommend hotel to friends and stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the Mark”
Reviews.Author: Stravelor
Reviews.Content: We chose Avia because of it's close proximity to the Napa Opera house, they offered a discount for prepayment and the ratings were fairly good. Avia wants to be a high end hotel but lacks the service to achieve that. I think the issues reflect the way the hotel is managed. It would be so easy to make this a nice experience but they missed the mark. What we expereinced: * Valet parking - No notification that this costs $15/day. No sign, no printing on the ticket, no discussion by the personanel. I discovered this when checking out. The valet parking and self park are in the same parking garage behind the hotel. It's easy to self park and I would have done so had I known. At checkout, I protested the fee since it was not disclosed but the attendant would not change the charge. Bad management. * Gym - We asked for the location of the gym and were told it's "next door". So, we walked down the street looking for it. It was next door but the entrance was behind the building. Once we arrived, the gym told us we needed a form filled out at the hotel. So, we had to return to the hotel for the form. Again, no one told us we needed a form. This unnecessary delay, walking back-forth and confusion could have been avoided had the personnel mentioned the process and entrance location when we inquired. Bad management. * Doormen - There was a group of doormen that serve to open the door and answer questions. It would be great if they had any knowledge to share - they don't. I saw people ask about restaurants, gym, etc and they seemed ill prepared to answer and their answers were incomplete (gmy, parking as examples). Why don't they have a prepared list to provide of local restaurants? Bad management. * Maid service - We left our room in the late morning. While in the room, we had a "do-not-disurb" sign. When we left, we flipped it to "service-room". We returned at the end of day and no service was performed. Since they do a turn down service, that means it was missed twice. * Room - The room has nice ammenities but is very, very small. The bed was extremely comfortable. * Restaurant - We ate at their restaurant the first night because it had good reviews. The food was fine but the seating was uncomfortable (weird shaped chairs) and staff amaturish. The restaurant is open and a loud group of people were sitting at the lounge area behind us, which was disturbing. It was an ok meal but for these prices, you'd expect better. We would not eat there again. *Location - It's in the heart of the city of Napa. The entire downtown area has been redeveloped and is fairly new. With the downturn in the economy over the last few years, many of the establishments in downtown Napa have left. We saw a lot of empty store fronts while walking to the Opera House. If I could do this over again, I would stay at a B&B or another hotel with more attentive management.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MonteNegra
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfection!! Absolutely everything was great! The staff was very down to earth and helpful yet friendly, I feel that AVIA accomadated every single one of my expectations. The location could nit have been better! If I has to pick ONE thing that I could not get over-it has to be the rooms. Simply breathtaking. We had 2 king size beds (which were divine) the shower was heavenly and had double sinks with LOTS of plugs everywhere! Could not stop talking about this place!!! Defintely a green light-GO!! You will not regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Colleen1021
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Avia Hotel in Napa! Our room was a suite room and it was very clean, modern design and the bathroom was to die for! (I would love that bathroom in my home!!) The beds were very comfortable, nice linens and we got a great nights sleep with no noise from other areas, which is sometimes a problem at other hotels. The room was very clean. Now, the hotel is located in downtown Napa, so you would need a car or a tour to get to the vineyards, which is only a 5-10 min drive to all the beauty. There are views of the valley and vineyards from the hotel as well. It was nice to grab a glass of wine at the bar, and sit in front of the fire and just relax!

Reviews.Title: “Fun younger side of Napa”
Reviews.Author: travelingmistress
Reviews.Content: Avia is exactly like what was advertised on the hotel's website. It's modern, clean, and a change from the chained hotel ambiance. The bathroom is large and uniquely designed and the rain shower feature is fantastic! The location is great and right in downtown where many good restaurants can be found all within walking distance. The hotel also offered free wine tasting and chair massages in the evening. We especially enjoyed the outdoor fire pit surrounded by rocking chairs and chair swings. The hotel breakfast buffett was nice too.I think our room and the additional features was worth the price especially for Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hip luxury in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: alicestader
Reviews.Content: The Avia Hotel Napa is a trendy hip boutique hotel located in downtown Napa, in the heart of California's wine country. The hotel's oversized wrought iron doors open to a modern and spacious lobby with a wine bar providing a convenient place to relax after a long day of wine tasting. The hotel website advertises "complimentary wine tasting every night in the lobby wine bar" however, it's actually a representative from a local winery offering a limited number of tastings. The night we stayed, he ran out of wine within 30 minutes. The 5-story hotel offers 141 stylish guestrooms and suites with hardwood floors and 9-ft. high ceilings. The rooms and suites vary in size and luxury. We booked the Master Tub Suite via the hotel's website. Initially we were given the wrong room, the Lux Suite, upon check-in and had to go back to the lobby with our confirmation email pulled up on our iPad to get the correct room. I recommend booking the upgraded Master Tub Suite. The Lux Suite is really just a large room with a too small haphazardly placed wall dividing the living space from the bedroom, whereas the Master Tub Suite had an actual wall dividing the two rooms. The Master Tub Suite included a comfortable king size bed, 42" flat screen television, iPod docking station, coffee maker and organic gourmet coffee, fluffy bath robes, a waterfall shower and an oversized tub located in the bedroom to soak in. The mini-bar is stocked with Dean & Deluca snacks and an assortment of beverages. When you check-in ask the front desk to "unlock" your mini-bar, it took us about ten minutes of fighting with the thing to figure out we had to call the front desk to open it up! Overall the Avia Hotel Napa is a great hotel for couples staying in Napa. Its conveniently located downtown so you don't have to drive to get a meal or glass of wine. The hotel is contemporary and stylish and quiet which is nice after a hard day of wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL--watch your bill, management is terrible”
Reviews.Author: tcinaz
Reviews.Content: Positives: This is a beautiful, modern hotel. the location is great, multiple restaraunts, bars and tasting rooms you can walk to. We were in a suite with a tub, fireplace and a great walk-in shower. Everyone that worked in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Negatives: We used the prepaid option on the hotel's website to book the room. On our way out they charged us again for our room. It took 3 consecutive days of calling for a manger to call us back. He then realized that it was their mistake, but yet still wouldn't refund the money until he did 2 more days of "Research". Great place to stay, but terrible managment. Watch your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruise_Ship_Tony
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Avia this past week. Nice time to go as Napa was not overrun by tourists. Very friendly check-in. Beautiful lobby with a bar and lots of seating. Backside of lobby is the restaurant and a small seating area with a fireplace. Beautiful outdoor seating area with a firepit that we never got to use as the rain came down the second night. Room was on the fifth floor: overlooked the patio area and a big parking garage (not the best view). Nice bathroom (not huge, but good-sized), king-sized bed, couch, desk. The TV rotates so you can watch it either from the couch or the bed (a nice feature). The first night I brought dinner and some wine to eat in the room. There is a fridge (full of purchase-able items) but no microwave. Two wine glasses and a bottle opener rounded out the assortment. Did our best to clean up (some tuperware containers and plates) but no real good place to wash things. The next day everything was washed for us. Wow what service! The locatoin is right down town, so you can walk to anything. Valet parking (fee) but free parking is a 3 minute walk around the back of the hotel. Overall, highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: jennyjcure
Reviews.Content: Avia is truly a terrific place to stay. The front desk was very helpful giving us suggestions but we really loved the concierge who really took charge and gave us such wonderful recommendations to Napa and the tastings. Our room was beautiful and very spacious. Breakfast downstairs was memorable with the french toast and omeletes. I've worked in great hotels but I was blown away by the hospitality and sincerity when we asked where to go and what to do. NExt door is a great Italian restaurant as well. The hotel has a great wine reception as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: radnip
Reviews.Content: We got there a little early and was promptly checked into an upgrade on the top floor with a view of First Street by Drew!! Great decor and some wear and tear but certainly not a big deal since you should be out exploring Napa and area!!! Great recommendations for food. We could not have been happier. Go to Angele!!! fabulous restaurant on the river

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: masalamujer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a four night vacation. The hotel was an absolute value for money especially when compared to the overpriced accomodations available in most of the Napa area; the hotel designer did a really nice job with the modern boutique style decor. First, it is one of the few actual hotels available--most are small bed and breakfast type accomodations. The rooms were large, especially our corner room, with an excellent bathroom and amenities. You had complimentary access to a real gym next door to the hotel, which is one of our musts for longer stays. Front desk staff were very accomodating and friendly, and you are within easy walking distance of many great dining options--definitely go to Norman Rose and Oenotri right across the street from the hotel. Some minor complaints include that the morning barista bar with breakfast to go type items are a bit over priced, and the coffee is not from proper espresso machines. Also, there were a couple of mini bar items charged to the room that weren't ours; staff promptly corrected it, but I wish hotels would stop using those sensor type mini bars that seem to always present a problem.

Reviews.Title: “AVIA Napa - hip & fun!”
Reviews.Author: kms21
Reviews.Content: The AVIA Hotel is located in downtown Napa CA. The hotel is new within the last few years. Has a hip & fun vibe. Rooms are well appointed in decor as are the lobby and lounge/bar area. The restaurant, Avia Kitchen, is warm & welcoming. We arrived in Napa on Thanksgiving Day and decided to eat right there at Avia Kitchen. The food was just good enough. Nothing special. This however is the only downside we found during our 7 day visit. Hotel staff were extremely helpful & friendly. When we were first shown the location of our room, right next to the elevator, Pierre at the front desk, was quick to change the room for us on the spot. We were very happy with the new room. Also the concierge staff was great. We were especially happy with Juliette Riedl. We worked with her to secure several reservations, food & spa, and she was professional, friendly, warm and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Totally exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to like about this hotel. In an area where they know how to do luxury well, but they also know how to charge for it then AVIA represents tremendous value for money. Firstly the booking process is novel, with the option to request upgraded rooms at reduced rates (and subject to availability at check-in time). So you don't know for sure whether you'll snag an upgrade, but if you do it won't cost as much as the standard rate for the room. This is a really good idea, and we got a tub suite at check-in instead of the standard room we had booked for a modest increase in price. The room was great; large, modern and sleek, but yet also cozy. The bed was really comfortable and as well as the tub, we also had a small sitting area with a second flat screen TV, and a fireplace. They offer a wine tasting most evenings in the lobby bar (incidentally the bar doubles as a coffee shop in the mornings), and we were lucky as the night we checked in it was a local brewery showcasing their beers. Just what the doctor ordered after tasting wine for a few days. We ate breakfast in their restaurant and were pleasantly surprised by the prices - we'd just come from a resort which charged $10 for an orange juice, and $8 for a coffee; at AVIA it was more like $3 each, and the quality was really no different. We also really enjoyed sitting by the fire-pit and talking with other guests as the sun went down, enjoying a glass of wine. We also can't praise the concierge enough, they found a shop selling difficult to get wine for me, and also gave us free tasting passes for several really good wineries. As much as I would like to, I just can't give the AVIA a rating of 5 as our room suffered a bit of a noise problem. It was seemingly above a loud refrigeration or air-conditioning unit which rumbled into life of its own accord during the night, and did wake us both on a few occasions (but we'd just come from the quietest hotel we'd ever stayed at, so anything would suffer in comparison). Also the housekeeping staff knocked to do a turn-down service just as my wife was stepping out of the shower. I asked them to give us 15-20 minutes as we were going out, and they agreed. Yet when we came back to the room after dinner, they hadn't returned. It would also be nice if the hotel had a pool. However, despite that I was still hugely impressed and pleasantly surprised by AVIA. Having stayed at a number of different hotels in the Napa Valley I thought that getting value and luxury in the same place was something that was impossible to find. It seems that AVIA proved me wrong, and we'll be staying there again when we go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Great room, comfy bed, service when you need it. Free parking.”
Reviews.Author: ocgolfer8
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night here on a quick wine weekend. We checked in late, with no issue. Very prompt and simple. Great room, we had the basic room. Perfect bed. The bathroom was excellent too. Super-sized shower. Great recommendation for dinner given. Check out was 2.5 seconds flat. Free parking 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience in Napa without the Napa prices!”
Reviews.Author: SJNelson
Reviews.Content: I randomly selected this hotel as we wanted to stay in a nice hotel with a little luxury...but not pay normal Napa Valley prices. It was an amazing experience! The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We loved the lounge outside where you can sit on the swings and by the fireplace. The bathroom was HUGE and had an amazing shower. I need white noise when I sleep and they left a fan in my room for me. I would stay at any Avia hotel! Simply wonderful! Also, there is a GREAT restaurant near the hotel, Grace's Table. You definitely need to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: discstu11
Reviews.Content: For the price, it hard to beat this upscale modern hotel in downtown Napa. The rooms were very nice and the hotel offered great service. My wife and I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: ImportSport
Reviews.Content: Avia on first, in downtown Napa is an excellent option for those wanting a full-service hotel. Avia offers modern styling, attentive staff, and spacious rooms at a reasonable cost. During a recent stay, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised to see the quality offered by Avia at a very reasonable cost. The location is excellent, allowing for an easy walk to a number of quality restaurants in the area and an easy drive to the mouth of the Napa valley and many of the more prominent vineyards and wineries.

Reviews.Title: “amazing in every way”
Reviews.Author: MK2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Avia from 11/20 - 11/24/2010 and just as many others have said, it was wonderful start to finish - definitaly 5 stars for us. We had a room with the extra sitting area (Lux perhaps?) and felt that it was so worth the upgrade. Was able to wake up early and watch TV or work on the computer while the hubby slept in. It was nice to have the extra space. The rooms are very clean and very modern. Wood floors, beds and pillows were amazing, all marble bathroom and the water pressure and hot water top notch. Request a room on the 5th floor and you'll have a great view of the mountains. But what really made our stay 5 star was the staff. Lisa at the front desk was a super star - thank you! From the doormen, to the cleaning staff, front desk and concierge everyone really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable - so pleasant and friendly, top notch customer service. The hotel is located right in the middle of town, walking distances to the Riverfront restaurants, Oxbow and Main Street. We loved the location and didn't have problems with noise. Since we all look for the critiques on tripadvisor, the one thing I would say is that if I were traveling during the summer months, a pool would be nice to have to enjoy after a day out and about. But as we were here in November, it was not an issue for us obviously. We would absolutely return to the Avia.

Reviews.Title: “Great In Every Way, We'll Be back! Love The Wood Floors!”
Reviews.Author: Chablis28
Reviews.Content: First of...we loved the wood floors! No hotel carpeting, yea! We just marveled at the well thought out design that went into this hotel. Our std room was awesome! This place is immaculate! The rooms were very quiet which we loved. Great pillows and matresses. The service was second to none starting with Vicki in reservations who never got tired of exploring room options with me prior to comming. Vicki is the best! I'm also very thankful to Juliette and another front desk gentleman who helped me coordinate getting my keys couriered same day from Avia to my SF hotel on Saturday the 13th. No keys would have meant a huge hassle when we got back to Minneapolis. Thank you Juliette! Sorry I forgot the other fellow's name. The front desk staff we're always chearful and willing. Can't say enough. If you want one tiny knock it might be that you had to go next door to a freestanding health club to workout but that wasn't a big deal. Everyone in our group loved this place. Great value here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great people, great food, GREAT STAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: saspiegel
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel late one evening, not quite sure what to expect. Were met by Nancy and Pierre at the front desk. They ensured our stay was so memorable, we booked another night! Great service guys! Many thanks! As far as the facilities are concerned, we can only compliment the hotel for excellence in every area! Needless to say, we will be back!!! - Andy and Samantha

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tripcat
Reviews.Content: Avia is everything the reviews say it is. The room was nice, the bed comfortable. Staff was warm and accommodating. The location is perfect. I have to say that in the one negative review the hotel has, the woman had a point. There is no sheering on the windows. There is some see though netting and black out curtains so you have dark room or totally open room. The sheering would be nice for privacy depending on the location of your room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliNCT
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Napa for 5 days over Columbus Day weekend with my husband and another couple and all my usual spots were booked solid. After browsing trip advisor this hotel popped up as available and had a good rating. What a great find, the price was right, location was good, hip decor, loved the bathroom. Take advantage of the wine tastings everyday at happy hour. We had dinner there our first night and the the food was very good. The only negative was that the room was a little small. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Avia Napa!”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Avia Napa for two nights in October and absolutely loved it. The room is spacious and the hotel is in great shape. The location is ideal for winery hopping and exploring downtown Napa. We only had two complaints which were minor....1) We thought we had booked a room with a bathtub but it wasn't the case. (booked through expedia but be careful with their false advertisement) 2) check in time is pretty late. We would definitely stay at Avia again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, if not for a couple of foibles”
Reviews.Author: dtc123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Avia for a weekend getaway. Our review would have been 5 stars were it not for a couple of strange service foibles. First of all, the hotel is almost brand new; the rooms are extremely clean and linens, beds and bathrooms are excellent. The location is right in the heart of the city of Napa; it is easily walkable to many of Napa's best restaurants. We had a few strange service issues. None of which, however, was a deal killer. When we checked in, we requested a late checkout. Always worried that these types of things don't get recorded, I later that evening walked to the front desk to confirm our late checkout request for the next night. It was not. The front desk said, however, that it would be no issue and entered the late checkout into the computer again. The next morning, we got a call from the front desk warning us that if we needed to check out. They didn't have our late checkout in the computer after two inputs into the system. It was no big deal, we ended up changing our plans and were leaving at that moment anyway, but still??? Lastly, the hotel concierge gave us a restaurant recommendation for brunch, gave us a printout of the address and driving directions. After driving for 45 minutes up into an absolutely obscure country road in the hills of Napa, I concluded that this couldn't possibly be right. My wife called the restaurant to learn that the hotel had given us the address of their associated ranch/farm and that the restaurant was half an hour away. So, two pretty serious goof ups. Thankfully neither ended up ruining our stay. We ended up not having an issue with our checkout b/c we ended up deciding to leave at noon and we weren't too hungry for our brunch! On the upside, they have a great hidden discount for California residents and generally speaking the service was very friendly. As mentioned before the facilities are very good and the price that we got was a tremendous value. I would stay here again but if I did, would check our checkout time repeatedly just to be sure =)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in Napa -- a real steal”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_TravelsSF
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Avia twice this year for last-minute Saturday night getaways -- both times we had excellent experiences. Both times we paid $199 the same day or day before we went. We stayed once in a suite, and once in a great room with a large patio and chaises. Staff was helpful and friendly. The lobby is well-appointed with a funky bar. We loved the rooms -- beautiful new bathrooms (showers, no tubs), nice linens, flat screens, all the amenities we like when we travel but a very nice price. We had breakfast in the hotel which was an incredible buffet and omelette bar for something like $16 -- a great value. We enjoyed dinner in downtown Napa -- very quick drive or long walk from this well-located hotel. You are not near vineyards at this hotel, but we've done that enough and actually prefer the location of the Avia, near the restaurants and other attractions like Oxbow market of downtown Napa. There's also free wireless here and the valet parking is easy and not that expensive -- maybe $10/night if I recall correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: ZCMC
Reviews.Content: We planned on staying at Avia for only one day as we passed through Napa to do the wine train. We arrived earlier than we anticipated so we weren't able to check-in for several hours. So, we had breakfast at the hotel and I must say that the breakfast was phenomenal. We opted to standby for an upgraded room and was upgraded to the Master Tub Suite which was beautiful. The living room area was cozy, the bed was comfortable, and the oversized tub and the fireplace just made our stay so much better. We had a view of the terrace, but since it was raining we didn't get to use it. Scott, who who saw at breakfast and at the bar the morning we arrived and the following day was extremely helpful, knowledgable, and friendly. We are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, short on service - Pierre was awesome, cleaning staff I wouldn't hire to clean a barn”
Reviews.Author: Tophergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the Avia Napa for a week while we toured Napa. We had a great package from Expedia, and were looking forward to this trip, as we don't often get to stay in boutique style hotels. The hotel is located right in the heart of Napa and within walking distance of dozens of restaurants and shops. Pierre, at the front desk, recognized how weary we were from our arrival and quickly processed our check in. I can't say enough about his skills, he was meant to be working with people as his professionalism and friendly demeanor was a welcome after 12 hours of travel. We had a basic king room at the end of the third floor, which had plenty of space for us to spread out and relax for the week. The hotel has a restaurant that we did not partake in, but it was very busy for breakfast so I must assume it was good. Where the hotel severely falls short is on it's cleaning staff. Not one day went by that we didn't have to call down for supplies to be replenished - be it coffee, soap, coffee mugs, wine glasses, etc. All items, by the way, were initially in the room when we checked in, so it would be safe to assume that these items would be replenished as part of the daily cleaning. The guest services staff were more than accommodating, and items were brought to us almost immediately. Our room was outside of their supply closet and we were awoken on most mornings around 8 by the chatter and laughing of the maids in the hallway. We also noticed that the toilet hadn't been cleaned, which again was far below what we expected. If the cleaning staff were expecting a tip, they did nothing to earn it. Next time I think we would choose one of the many B&B's that are just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Missing an "F" and a screw!”
Reviews.Author: greendezine
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to Avia Napa, we were impressed by the lobby's modern, eclectic decor. The front desk was pleasant with no additional offerings but the key to the room. We had reserved a Classic King guestroom with the possible option to upgrade, but when we arrived they claimed to be sold out. The room was nicely decorated but under closer scrutiny there were some "small" but annoying issues. On the floor was some sort of debris that housekeeping missed while cleaning. The TV was cleverly disguised on one side with a wood panel and a quote in iron letters by Benjamin Franklin, but the "F" was missing! The air conditioning panel in our room was also missing a screw! I began to worry about the cleanliness of the room due to the lack of attention to detail. We had reservations at Avia Kitchen for a pre-theater dinner but the dining seats at the table were so uncomfortable, we had to leave. After a long day of travel and activities we headed back to our rooms only to find that there had been no turn down service. When we called downstairs, they were so short of staff they sent the Valet attendant to turn down the bed. The next morning at breakfast we were greeted by a very sour hostess who we really felt we were bothering by asking for a table for breakfast. Fortunately the food was very good. The next night we did have turn down service, but the mini bar and coffee stations had not been restocked. For the price of the rooms at Avia Napa, the service and attention to detail was completely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located in the heart of Napa”
Reviews.Author: uclabennett
Reviews.Content: My wife, 4 year old daughter and I stayed here a couple of weekends ago. The curb appeal of this hotel is fantastic. We arrived at night and the new restaurant across the street was buzzing with energy, many people were still strolling up & down the street, and it was nothing like the nighttime verison of downtown Napa I remembered from the years I spent growing up there. The rooms were immaculate and service was very friendly. The bellhop was extremely friendly and even though we did not use the valet, the folks down at the valet in front of the hotel were friendly and helpful too. Parking was a little tricky since we weren't using valet since you have to park in the downtown parking garage back behind the hotel. It isn't connected directly so you have to walk outside down the street and then take an elevator (or stairs) up to the 3rd floor of the parking garage. This hotel wasn't exactly cheap and while it isn't exactly the Four Seasons, I think it was worth the stay. It was perfectly situated for site-seeting downtown Napa as well as for access back onto the Napa freeways and highways. If location and cleanliness are not tops on your list then you won't feel like you are getting what you paid for. If they are, then there is no other hotel in Napa I think you'd rather stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at Avia - Napa”
Reviews.Author: lynnlynnTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avia Napa for 4 nights in a "Lux Suite". Suite: The bed was really comfy, not too soft or firm. Love the inclusion of the robes to use there. Bathroom was a good size and plenty of soft towels/washcloths/hand towels. There is a mini-fridge in the room also, but there is only 1 shelf available for use. The rest is stocked with mini-bar, and if you remove anything from its slot, your room is automatically charged for it (same with counter top snacks). Overall, it was a really nice suite with a plush and modern feel to it. Amenities: The hotel has a fire pit and an indoor fireplace available for evening use. The parking facility is the Clay Street garage behind the hotel. They don't have a workout facility on-site, but instead you get vouchers for a fitness center next door to the hotel (note this fitness center isn't open 24x7, so depending on your schedule, it can be inconvenient). We did not eat at the hotel at all, so I can't comment on the restaurant. Location: it is a nice location, and you can easily walk around downtown Napa. Any interesting restaurants do tend to get busy in the evening, so be prepared for a wait. And, if you are there to visit Napa/Sonoma wineries, it is not a long drive from the hotel (depending on where you want to visit). There is nothing really negative to say about our stay here. We would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They overcharged us $1800 on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: scaplan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avia on our Honeymoon in Napa. Beautiful room, nice hotel, but the service was AWFUL! There is literally no-one to help you in the lobby, no attendants on the deck, and we were over-charged $1800 after our stay. 2 months after calling back the charges were reversed without an apology. I guess that's such service as usual for the Avia.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: Panda_and_Flossy
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in September 2010 with the intention of using the hotel as base for exploring Napa. As for Downtown Napa the hotel could not be better located with all shops and ammenities within walking distance. The hotel itself is very modern from the moment you walk into and the theme continues into the hotel rooms which are spacious. It was obvious to us that care and thought has gone into the design of this hotel as the layout, fixtures and fittings are all to a very high standard. The hotel also features an outdoor terrace with fire and nice bar area in the lobby area which offers a free daily wine tasting. Another benefit to this hotel was the free parking in the adjacent multi-storey car park. If we were to stay in Donwtown Napa again we would not hesitate to re-visit the Avia

Reviews.Title: “Decent luxury hotel in downtown napa”
Reviews.Author: DelfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights as a base for exploring wine country. Well located spot and a walk from the bars and restaurants of downtown Napa (which was a much more quaint and pleasant town than I had expected). Good service all round and the real treat was drinking wine sat in the rocking chairs next to the fire pit in the evening. Would recommend as a base to stay for a wine trip - use Beau wine tours and also we hired bikes from Napa outdoor adventures to do a self guided day in the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel - Clean, Quiet and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jeff692
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our four day tour of Napa Valley vineyards. All six of us liked this hotel. In a quiet area of town. Enjoyed dinner at Carpe Diem, about two blocks from the hotel and Mustards, about 20 minutes out of town. Had a GREAT lunch at the CIA. Stop there if you can. A word of warning. There is a chain style steak house about two blocks from Avia. Food is aweful. No pool at the hotel but you can use a gym next door. Free wine tasting each evening. Hotel has a nice looking resturant but we never had the opportunity to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Manups
Reviews.Content: Everything very good, much better than I expected... Wonderful memories for my 3rd anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: lisa12450
Reviews.Content: great location dinning down stairs with a cozy fireplace. wine bar was fun an informative. the only downside was navigating from the parking garage to the room. wish parking was smoother. all in all still a nice place to spend the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: cheesehead5
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location. Really nice room. We had a fireplace and a big bathtub. Beautiful outdoor patio WI fire pit. Very quiet room. Free parking behind the building. Close to a great restaurant, Ristorante Allegria ( separate review).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ncfamof4
Reviews.Content: Loved the area, decor and space! The rooms were beautiful and modern. Free parking available and a beautiful terrace with a fire pit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern accommodations in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ajmflan
Reviews.Content: Avia is conveniently located in downtown Napa, within easy walking distance of the Napa River, restaurants and the Oxbow market. There is free parking behind the hotel which is easy to navigate in and out of for a day of wine tasting. The room we stayed in was extremely quiet and we were adjacent to the elevators. The room was large, modern, clean and nicely laid out. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, minor problems”
Reviews.Author: jkennedy10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of friends for 6 nights. The hotel is beautiful, new, modern, and scrupulously clean. The location is great and you can walk to many restaurants in downtown (although Oenotri across the street had terrible food and worse service). As part of a deal with the hotel you are allowed to use the full gym next door, a rare luxury. The staff at the hotel was exceptional - very courteous and helpful. Special thanks to the bar staff who were excellent! The rooms were large and well-appointed, and even had a soaking tub. There is also an outdoor deck with firepit and rocking chairs where we spent almost every evening. There were a few minor complaints that would probably not have been an issue if we hadn't stayed for so many nights. We never seemed to have an extra roll of toilet paper and had to call several times for an extra roll. The room was not cleaned as well over the weekend and there was a marked difference between the weekday and weekend cleaning. I requested foam pillows but was told by the front desk the hotel didn't have any. Finding this extraordinary I finally called the manager and received foam pillows on the last day. Would have been nice to have them from the beginning. We had two packages delivered to the hotel, neither of which the front desk was able to find. One still has not shown up. The valet parking took entirely too long - sometimes 20 minutes to get our cars. Overall, we very much enjoyed Avia and would definitely stay here again. It's a beautiful hotel, right in downtown Napa. Very convenient and with all of the modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: emkay09
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I travel with our kids, cleanliness is a priority. When we travel without the kids, we look for that and a lot more â€“ basically we shoot for luxury. We went to Napa and found Avia on the web, and are we glad we did. If you are looking for luxury in Napa, this is the place. The rooms are fantastic â€“ modern furnishings, marble baths, and depending on the room, great views. We found our stay to be worth every penny. The service was great, whether it be at the desk, the door, the concierge or the lounge. We enjoyed our wine tasting held for guests, and everyone went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. We liked the location right in town (and had a great dinner at Coles). I would absolutely recommend Avia for anyone wanting luxury in Napa. While I am not sure we will ever get out there again, if we do, Avia will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Lawyer
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were happy with Avia. We understood that we were staying in downtown, not near the wineries. For downtown, the location is great. Everything seems to be within walking distance, yet parking is close and readily available if you feel like driving. The room itself was clean, quiet and well-appointed, if on the smaller side. My only complaint was having to choose between privacy or natural light. Our room (443?) looked out directly onto the top floor of the parking garage (we could've practically touched the cars). The lack of view by itself would not have bothered me, but there was no light filtering curtain, just a see-through open grid pattern drape and a blackout curtain. So, any time we didn't want to be in full view of anyone in the garage, we had to have the blackout shades pulled. This could easily be remedied by putting light filtering, yet opaque, drapes in rooms with this problem. We felt this hotel was competitively priced with other similar properties. It's unfortunate that there's a two-night minimum on the weekend, but I guess that's to be expected in the high season.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: dinab101
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Avia hotel in downtown Napa. Check in was easy and we immediately walked to some of the shops in town. Found a place with fantastic cupcakes! The room was extremely comfortable and bathroom very nice. The price was right for such a nice place and the service was excellent. The only thing that could have been improved was to have water available in the lobby. We also loved the terrace with the fire pit, very relaxing to have a glass of wine before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Perfect, Amazing. . . . .”
Reviews.Author: jjdewey84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to visit Napa as a getaway after his year deployment. i chose the AVIA and will never stay anywhere else in Napa! This hotel is gorgeous!!!!!! We got an excellent rate and were upgraded to a balcony suite when we got there. Our room was huge and on the corner so we had 3 balconies that overlooked the city! It was only 225 a night! First of all everything about this hotel is perfect! All of the staff is friendly, from the valet to thegues services to the bell hop. The bed was so comfortable and the room sparkling clean! The bathtub- pretty sure it couldn't get any sexier. the placement right next to the bed, the sheer curtain separating them, and the lighting was the perfect combination to induce romance. Being able to lay in the warm tub and look out on the views of the city was perfect!!! The location of the hotel is great! We enjoyed walking around town and enjoying the smells of the restaraunts. We ate at the restaraunt across the street- can not remember the name but it was delicious! Gourmet burgers and fries. I had the Lamb burger and parmesan and truffle fries. So good!! We never did try the restaraunt in the hotel or find our way to the fire pit but plan on staying here again soon. If you are looking for a romantic getaway then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi54
Reviews.Content: The Avia was awesome and the staff is one of the best I have encountered in a long time (if ever). The hotel is in historic downtown Napa! It is a smaller hotel -141 rooms- with an eye to detail! I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family! And to anyone else heading to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “What more needs to be said of this Napa jewel...”
Reviews.Author: jimmy444
Reviews.Content: Avia is the perfect hotel, hip, comfy, stylish, great customer service and location in a great part of downtown Napa. You will want to return to Napa and you will want to return to Avia...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: rangerfan58
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. We were a little nervous going in since we never really heard anything about it from people we knew but we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were so comfortable and well thought of. We went for the suite with the tub and that was amazing. Able to soak and enjoy the fireplace and tv! It is in an area of Napa that is starting to build up, seems like many empty stores but they look like more are coming. Some nice new restaurants across the street. The coffee in the morning was very nice in the lobby. The outside get together area was very nice, had a fire going, outside bar and swings. We did not find the drive to the other towns that long at all about 20 minutes on the highway and it was a nice drive. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky decor and excellent service in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMarty
Reviews.Content: From the valet, to the front desk clerks, to the concierge, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. One bellboy heard us speaking french and said a few words to us. The valet radioed the front desk clerk as we were getting out of the car, and the front desk clerk greeted us by name. Now that's a Wow. The hotel has a gym, a beautiful restaurant, and a 2nd floor outdoor terrace with outdoor firepit and rocking chairs. Walking distance to great restos like Celadon and Angele. Rooms small but clean. The decor is very eclectic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Hotel In Napa!”
Reviews.Author: sactomike1
Reviews.Content: Living in Northern California it's only a short drive to Napa from Sacramento. We have stayed at many hotels & B&B's in the Napa Valley but the Avia Hotel in Napa is our new favorite. Very well located in downtown Napa it is walking distance to some terrific restaurants. The hotel is well appointed and actually quite luxurious for the price. The staff always seemed to have a smile on their face and even opened the front door each time we entered or exited the building. A great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect - Would Stay Here Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: texastraveler2002
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Avia...we ended up Avial in a pinch & panic when our room at another establishment did not work out...Valerie helped us make the reservation over the phone and she was an absolute angel! She even came out to greet us and make sure we were well taken care of upon check in. We loved the room, the two flat screens, and the super hot shower. Marina, the concierge made finding our winery visits simple and she made sure that we went to places that focused on the type of wines we prefer. Our stay was absolutely perfect and I would absolutely recommend Avia to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, Great restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler23Chicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully designed. The staff was excellent, esp. in the hotel restaurant. I went with a friend and we did have a bad experience with one of the concierge staff members that was really rude. I took it up with hotel management and they were great about apologizing for her unfortunately rude behavior. The restaurant in this hotel is excellent in my opinion. They should really highlight is more. My room was small but nice. The terrace area is great for relaxing. I would definitely recommend this hotel it is located in walking distance of a lot of other great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Ok location”
Reviews.Author: demetgolf
Reviews.Content: This is a nice addition to Napa Valley. The hotel was clean, the staff were very courteous and helpful. The location is improving, but it is a long drive to the North end of the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: pucgal
Reviews.Content: I rarely stay in Napa when I am in the valley. This trip I needed to drop my daughter off early at Evans. I tripped over Avia's mention in a recent issue of Departures magazine and made a reservation. What a welcome surprise! A chic hotel of a quality I did not expect to find in Napa. The rooms are very comfortable and the large bathrooms with walk in showers are wonderful. Everyone we met on the staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is I had the misfortune of having a neighbor who watched loud TV until 3:30 AM on a Monday morning. The ice machine also makes a racket all night with its use, so try and avoid a room near it if you want quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, cool hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lorraine6225
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avia for a few nights, what a beautiful gem! So lovely, very chic rooms where you feel so relaxed and pampered. Clean and lovely. The shower is amazing. Loved everything about this hotel. The service is good but casual. The only bad things were the room service menu is too limited, the free coffee in the lobby was not refreshed enough and their lost and found practices were poor. I left something in the room and didn't get it back. But other than that it is great, just need to up the attention to detail a little.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JzW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avia in a Lux Suite over the July 4 weekend and it was excellent. The hotel is great - nice rooms, excellent amenities, friendly staff. The hotel is chic and modern but still comfortable and warm. Rooms are excellent. The 2nd floor terrace is excellent. I didn't eat in the restaurant, but it looked nice. The only minor negative is that the hotel bar is small and it closes early if you want a nightcap. For some reason, nothing in downtown Napa seems to stay open late. I assume downtown Napa will develop a nightlife over time, but right now, it does not exist. That being said, I would not hesitate to stay here again and the hotel makes a great base for touring the Napa valley. Access to the valley highways from downtown Napa is excellent and there are some really good restaurants in walking distance from the hotel. As far as the nightlife goes, it's not like there is a much to do in Yountville or St Helena after dinner either.

Reviews.Title: “AVIA--stylish and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilano
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avia Napa Hotel for 2 nights in late June 2010 and was very impressed by the room (a deluxe suite). It had a very contemporary design and was roomy, with a separate small living area with a couch and coffee table. Someone brilliantly designed a rotating flat screen TV on a half-wall, so that you could watch the TV from bed or rotate it and watch from the small living area. The king bed was exceptionally comfortable. There was a small desk in the bedroom area, along with two nightstands. The bathroom was huge and very stylish (although the beautiful half-wall of glass didn't totally keep the spray from the very nice, large walk-in shower from getting some of the bathroom floor wet). The bathroom was all marble--even the walls--and had a huge vanity countertop with a basin-style farmhouse sink. (and the much more water-efficient single-handle faucet that all hotels should have). The room really felt like a haven--quiet, Zen-like, beautiful. My only complaint about the room was that the a/c unit was quite loud and only had a one-speed (high) fan. I had to turn it off in order to sleep, but then the room got too warm--since it was very hot in Napa--so I got back up and turned it on a few times. But it did cool the room very well. The hotel was still doing construction on a new wine-bar downstairs in the lobby area, so there was some hammering during the middle of the day, but since the manager made sure I got a room on the top floor (5th), it was very quiet in my room. I think the construction will be over soon, but if you're concerned, just contact the hotel ahead of time to ask for a quiet room on a higher floor. The staff were cordial and professional, and the concierge was especially nice and helpful. There's an area with several computers one can use for free. There's a huge terrace at the hotel, but the one time during my trip that it was cool enough to want to sit outside, it was closed for a private event.The hotel provides a free wine-tasting from 5-6 each day. The room service menu doesn't have too many choices. I didn't try the food at the hotel, but the breakfast buffet seemed like a pretty good deal. In spite of being downtown--but in a rather charming area of downtown--it was quiet around the hotel--and easy to self-park, either in the free garage parking provided by the hotel or even on the street, if you're coming and going. As others have noted recently, a number of storefronts in downtown Napa are now vacant and/or awaiting more urban renewal. There are a number of restaurants (and even a Safeway supermarket) within a few blocks of the hotel. The nice Oxbow Market and riverfront area are nearby. I highly recommend Sweetie's Bakery-Cafe for breakfast; it's near the riverfront. The riverfront area is a bit disappointing, since some of it overlooks industrial things rather than a woodsy river. I highly recommend the nice drive up a small mountain to the Hess Collection with a very impressive modern/contemporary art collection (and good wine, to boot). All in all, if you're looking for a reasonably priced, stylish, comfortable, centrally located, and quiet hotel in the Napa area, you can't go wrong with the Avia. Compared to some of the other boutique hotels (and especially the many high-priced B & B's in the Napa valley), it's a great alternative. I was there alone to relax and unwind and not for a romantic getaway, but I think the Avia would be a good choice for different kinds of travellers. They seem to have various good deals available (e.g., on weekdays), and they offer a good "staycation" rate for Californians. If you prefer modern/contemporary hotels to frills and frou-frou (as I do), and if you'd rather be in a pet-free rather than a pet-friendly nonsmoking hotel, as I also do, this is a great choice. marilano

Reviews.Title: “AVIA Napa is WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: soonerpsych
Reviews.Content: We stayed with AVIA Napa for our honeymoon and were beyond satisfied. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are chic and elegant. We stayed in a master tub suite and were very pleased. The shower and tub are both romantic and relaxing. The bed is extremely comfortable! I loved that the lights all had dimmers as well. Room amenities are great: the soap is the best bar soap I've ever used, and I love that they provide q-tips. They do free wine and appetizer tastings each afternoon, and the kitchen/wine bar is excellent. We loved the terrace with porch swings as well. I was hesitant with this hotel initially from reviews against its location, but my husband and I were pleasantly surprised. It sits in a cute area of downtown Napa, near shopping and restaurants. While you need car service or a rental car to get to wineries and restaurants in nearby towns like Calistoga and Yountville, the drive is very easy and self parking is free in the garage right behind the hotel (you can valet, but you're wasting your money, it's a 50 foot walk to the back side door). Dowtown Napa is very walkable from the hotel, we walked to breakfast and Oxbow Market. Overall, FANTASTIC stay. We will definitely return to AVIA Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location. Rooms are...”
Reviews.Author: Tbandmb
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, great location. Rooms are luxurious a true vacation experience. Our concierge Juliette was very helpful and kind; she made us great reservations at different wineries and restaurants . We will definitely be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly chic hotel in the heart of Napa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at Avia for our honeymoon in Napa, and we were absolutely blown away by the hotel design, service and overall atmosphere the moment we arrived. The concierge was extremely helpful at recommending and booking winery tours that aligned with our interests and tastes. The restaurant had the best hotel food that I have ever tasted and a great wine selection (with daily tastings). Our hotel room was amazing and tastefully decorated - very chic yet comfortable. We liked our room so much that we decided to extend our stay in Napa two extra days (versus staying in San Francisco which is what we had previously planned).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher3
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a beautiful hotel. I was in Napa celebrating my 40th birthday with friends and stayed for 2 nights at the Avia. The staff is so friendly and helpful! It is in the perfect location in the middle of the city. The beds are unbelievable:)) So comfortable! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, what a great birthday! Thanks Avia.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: VickinNewYork
Reviews.Content: We got married in Napa Valley and stayed along with our guests at Avia Hotel. What a great decision that ended up being. The rate was well below the neighboring hotels but the service was ridiculously high level. One of our guests even spilled red wine on his shirt at dinner and they sent up club soda, salt and vinegar to help him at his room. The rooms were modern and large and they even mailed us a package of belongings we accidentally left in a rush when we left for our honeymoon...what hotel does that??? The location is also great because its in downtown Napa so you have access to restaurants and bars so we had a nightlife which was also appreciated. The breafast was also amazing and well priced. Then they offered comp. wine pairings weekdays which were great and lent a level of sophistication to our event. We would absolutely stay again in the future when you consider everything. We could not ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Avia might be the best hotel I have visited in some time!”
Reviews.Author: DonaldE
Reviews.Content: Wow, Avia Napa has really hit a homerun with this property. It is located downtown, which seems to be in the midst of considerable revitalization. The hotel itself is as well designed as I have ever seen. The rooms are spacious, and include a living room, fireplace, two flat screen tvs, ipod radio, separate bathtub, walkin shower, double sinks,... It is very well laid out, and has all the modern conveniences a person would want. The hotel room seemed more like a well-designed apartment than a hotel room. Also, the hotel has a second floor courtyard with a firepit -- this was a great place for social gatherings, although it closed at 10pm. I also give especially high marks to Juliette, the hotel concierge. She arranged a train ride to St. Helena (great little town) for their monthly street festival, arranged a bike wine tour with a great host ("Tom"), and arranged dinner reservations at Farmstead which was an amazing new restaurant 20 minutes north of Napa. I can't say enough great things about this hotel, and Juliette made it a very special trip (albeit too short!). I highly recommend choosing this hotel for your stay. One more thing -- two blocks away is the Bounty Hunter bar (wine & beer; no mixed drinks) that was alot of fun, and had surprisingly good bar food too.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning. Absolutely perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: kissylips96
Reviews.Content: I am so picky, and I know my travel. In fact, I run a travel planning site, so I went over this place with a fine tooth comb. There is nothing bad to say--it is extremely chic, convenient, modern, warm, and fun. I had a fabulous room with a tub next to the bed (upgrade for the bday girl), they had wine tasting downstairs in the evening, it was just impeccable. I wish the weather was better when we were there, because they have a fabulous outdoor patio on the roof of the 1st or 2nd floor, and there are benches and firepits--looks very zen and fun to have a glass of wine with friends. Come here, it is amazing. And take a trip to Caldwell Vineyards while you are at it!! You won't regret either:)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in best location downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: anderstein
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel for those wanting to stay downtown and walking distance to shops and restaurants. Clean modern room, comfortable bed, free WiFi, great TV. Friendly and helpful staff and concierge. Free convenient parking around the corner. Perfect place to come "home" to after a day of wine tasting! Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic atmosphere, comfy beds, free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: GlamourSparty
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and an Expedia special rate. The hotel has an eclectic atmosphere and great location if you want to be downtown Napa, it is within walking distance of everything. At check-in I mentioned that it was our one year wedding anniversary trip and inquired as to whether they had any upgrades available. Pierre at the front desk worked his magic and transferred us to a tub/fireplace suite starting the following night at no extra charge. It was a very nice gesture on the hotelâ€™s part. Both rooms were really nice and the beds are very comfortable. I suggest taking a class of wine to the 2nd floor deck which has a lot of great porch swings. Also the hotel breakfast buffet is very good â€“ they have both continental and full breakfast options although that is not made very clear. The only negative thing I have to say is that my husband ordered roses, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries which were supposed to be delivered first thing the day of our actual anniversary. The items did not arrive until much later in the day after we came back from our winery tour. He was disappointed as he really wanted to start the day out with the surprise. However to make up for it the hotel included extra roses in the arrangement. One other piece of adviceâ€¦if youâ€™ve never been to the area I would suggest staying in Yountville or St. Helena. Those downtowns are more quaint and seem to have more going on.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in downtown Napa!”
Reviews.Author: nikkitta21
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked almost brand new; the lobby was quite interesting, loved the decor, tres chic! The room was spacious, CLEAN, and quiet. Coffee was complimentary in the lobby every morning, which was an added bonus, and there are complimentary wine tastings in the evenings. We had a great stay at this hotel! We also loved it because it is smoke and pet free, so it is great for people with allergies and/or asthma!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Napa”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirlSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: After a sleepless night at a B&B listening to street noise (in an alleged quiet room), tossing and turning in a lumpy bed, a cold breakfast and colder management, my husband and I decided we would check leave quaint and rather than drive home find another place in Napa to spend our second night. A quick check on Tripadvisor revealed rooms available at Avia. We drove over and Andrew at the front desk made us feel welcome and booked us into a wonderful room (317) at a lower price than the dank and dreary B&B. What we got was a two room suite, a wonderful bathroom with a rainforest shower, real internet service, a patio and a large flat screen T.V. We also found the room to be absolutely quiet and a very comfortable bed! Avia was such a welcome relief! We are picky travelers and don't mind paying for quality accomodations and service. The decor was soothing as was the ambiance of the hotel. We did not eat at Avia so I cannot comment on the quality of food but we are anxious to return for a longer stay to enjoy all that the hotel has to offer. Napa is well served by this downtown addition within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. Thanks again to Andrew and the management of Avia. We will not need to look at further when visiting the Valley again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay--staff and location were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: grandparentsonthego
Reviews.Content: Suites were great, had a corner room overlooking First Street. Staff could not have been more accommodating. Maria, concierge, was over the top. Location is great, can walk to any of the super restaurants in downtown Napa--cannot put a price on that after spending the day wine tasting. Hotel bar is very small and like many Napa bars, serves only beer/wine.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lipinsk2
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Great beds and bathroom ... the two most important things in a hotel. Also found the concierge very helpful in suggesting and booking beau wine tours for us. Liked the location close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine5005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short weekend trip to Napa for a friend's birthday. Loved the character and our room was nice and comfy. Breakfast buffett's (for $12-$16) were good with prices to be expected. Doormen, concierge and front desk were all super helpful and always friendly. Only downside is the location! The area where the hotel is located was too quiet for our taste. Not much going on, virtually no one around. We happened to be there during a beautiful weekend too, weather in the mid-70s with no rain or clouds.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Wendy056
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on TripAdvisor - super location - just opened in 2009 - beautiful rooms - big bathrooms with 2 sinks - came in handy as we were traveling with our 25 year old daughter. Loved that we had 2 King beds in our room - modern, lovely decor. Great wine hour each night - neat open area on 2nd floor roof with firepit and party cabanas. Could walk to our restaurants both nights - Cole's Chophouse (great steakhouse) and Allegria (great Italian). Took our own wine both nights to restaurants for small corkage fee. Would definitely stay here again. Two nice bars across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: mlcallan
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Napa with three other couples - we all stayed at Avia and loved our experience. The front desk folks were helpful and polite, the concierge was amazing, sent us to an awesome winery which we would have NEVER found without her. Loved the outdoor terrace for drinks by the fire in the evening before dinner was nice as well as the hotel restaurant. For the money, this was hands down the best place to stay! Hotel staff went above and beyond with a special birthday gift waiting for me in our Lux Suite upon arrival, over the top! Lastly, the bathroom is spacious, loved the large shower with dual shower heads. The bed was very comfortable which was much needed after a long day of wine tasting and eating. Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ending of my Trip sorta ruined by Avia”
Reviews.Author: nyugirl2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avia hotel in Napa from the 25th to the 27th of April. The service was great MINUS the concierge desk. My boyfriend and I met with the lady working there, she took our credit card information and claimed to book a Napa Train tour for us. She printed us our confirmation form and told us to meet at the station about 15 minutes prior to boarding to pick up our tickets. We went to the train station and were told NO tickets were bought and paid for and that we can purchase NEW ones to get on the train. WE WERE TOLD THAT OUR TRIP WAS BOOK BY AVIA! Upset, I called the front desk at Napa and they blamed the train and the Train Company blamed Avia. Either way, the ending to our trip was ruined by not having gone on the train tour. This is upsetting on many levels, no one took responsibility for their actions or even tried to rectify the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: chrisonthetown
Reviews.Content: PROS: Modern, but still charming hotel. Clean, well designed rooms, big flat TV, comfortable bed, fridge with space for own drinks, large windows, IPod stand (we had the Lux Suite). Friendly, attentive staff. Good breakfast at reasonable price (compared to another venue down the block). Large outdoor terrace with free wine happy hour. Walking distance to bars (across the street too!) and some wonderful restaurants (Angele, Celadon). Free off-lobby internet computers Plenty of free parking at next door garage which was very convenient. CONS: No floor soda/water dispensers. Hotel restaurant doubles as their wine bar â€“ not really the best atmosphere for a glass of wine. When planning a visit to Napa again, we will surely consider Avia.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel. Great for the money.”
Reviews.Author: martinridge
Reviews.Content: Just by walking through the front door.... you know you have made the right choice. First of all it's in the heart of downtown Napa. It's within walking distance of several great restaurants and bars. A great starting off point to head north on your wine tasting adventures. We arrived to the hotel a few days after they had a large water line burst and flooded the ground floor ( lobby ) with two inches of water warping the floors. They were in the process of attempting to restore the wood floors when we arrived so there was a bit of construction going on, but so what..... things happen. I heard several people mention that the floors actually looked very rustic because of the warping. Any way, it wasn't a big deal. Check in went smoothly and everyone we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. There is free self parking at the back of the the hotel with a very short walk to the front door or a $15 valet fee per day with all the in and out privileges you need. The room we had was on the 5th floor. 519. Right next to the elevators. We could never hear the elevators or anyone out in front of them so it was never a problem. But we could hear the people on the other side of the elevators, which again wasn't a problem for us because it was my sister. But if you didn't like listening to my sister and brother in law laughing.... it may be a problem. The rooms are Fantastic!!!! They are very large (we had a Luxe room) nice hardwood floors, swivel TV so you could watch it while in bed or while watching it in the sitting area that has a small couch. Very comfortable king size bed with comfortable crisp sheets. There is a large bathroom with one sink and plenty of counter space. There is a lighted magnified mirror. Ladies... Don't look deeply into this!!!!!! You will scream and run for the tweezers! But... do what you gotta do! The shower has two shower heads, one rain head shower and a hand held shower head. Our water was as hot as you want for as long as you want. The only complaint or suggestion would be about the open shower area. there is just small glass pane that really doesn't keep any of the water in the shower. So just make sure you have 2 or 3 towels down to soak up the water and keep you from slipping and breaking you neck while getting out of the shower. I didn't have a problem wiping up the water, but you shouldn't have to and I can see some people really complaining about this. The view from our 5th floor room was of the parking structure at the rear of the hotel. beautiful.... no but we really didn't spend that much time looking out at the views.
